hasVariant.description: Buy the Mystery Ranch Full Moon 6.3L Lumbar Pack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Just the size I was looking for.Great for traveling without wear a day pack.
review.name: Butt pack

review.reviewBody: I’m really embracing my Fanny pack era with this thing. Holds my nalgene, kid’s water, snacks for us both, wallet, phone, etc. works for hiking too. Looks great, absolutely solid construction. My gripes are that the waist belt does not stay tight once adjusted, and there’s no built-in excess webbing management
review.name: Great Dad Bag

review.reviewBody: This is a great small pack, but it is really large for a "small" pack. I could easily go into the woods for a day trip and have more than enough room for the items I want to take. With a little extra padding that could be added by the user, this is a great size for a point-and-shoot or bridge size camera (or a DSLR with one lens). I really like that the straps match the bag color but only one zipper (front pocket) matches. The top zipper is a lighter brown shade, close to the zipper pulls in color. The compression straps work very well to stabilize the items inside and there are webbing loops on each end to add a clip to attach extra items (like gloves). A 27 ounce Kleen Kanteen or a 32 ounce Nalgene will fit inside with room for more gear. The grab handle on the back is a nice touch in a waist/sling pack. The back panel is well padded. I would have preferred if the waist/shoulder strap were about 4 to 6 inches longer. All in all, a superb small pack that works as much larger than it appears.
review.name: Full Moon Wood Waxed - Great pack with good execut

review.reviewBody: Makes a perfect small diaper kit for my kiddos! Works so well, I had to get my wife one. Holds 5-8 pull ups, wipes, medicine and some snacks. Everything I need, nothing I don't. It's easy to overpack with kids, so smaller bag forces you to just take the essentials.
review.name: Perfect small pack!

review.reviewBody: this is good for extra storage for day trips or for a few items on a quick hike.  I would not buy this if you are looking to use for concealed carry. The main large compartment is the only spot big enough for a decent size pistol.  In my opinion, it should have a third zipper compartment behind the main compartment as it feels like too much room.  but, otherwise the quality is good and the bag is comfortable as a hip pack.
review.name: capacious

review.reviewBody: Love the size and durability. Smaller zippered pockets great for organizing. Fit my power bank, cords, slim insulated hydroflask and iPad pro for carry on. As well as smaller items like airpods, etc. Can carry as hip or cross-body comfortably
review.name: Great size. Perfect for Air Travel

review.reviewBody: Size, quality, and color scheme are all top notch. Great purchase. Only thing I'd love to see is a slide stop included so it stays where you set the straps without aftermarket materials on it.
review.name: Solid bag

review.reviewBody: This pack is simple and just the right size. I’ve had other packs with lots of features and capacity but they all seemed to be to large or had special features like water bottles holders that I just didn’t use. You don’t have to use all the capacity of a large waist pack but then it just seems to sag down but you butt. This one is well made and just the right size and a minimum of specialized features.
review.name: Just the right size!

review.reviewBody: The pack is awesome. Wore it cross body through a 5 mile hike. Never once did I complain. Holds enough snacks for 6 people throughout the hike. Only critique would be more padding in the strap for those that wish to wear it cross body. Even as a hip belt, it could use padding. Maybe even lock strap adjusters where you lengthen and shorten the strap. Other than that, amazing. Would highly recommend.
review.name: Awesome pack!

review.reviewBody: It’s perfect for hiking and skiing, fits perfectly and securely around the waist
review.name: Just what I was looking for

name: Full Moon 6.3L Lumbar Pack

review.itemreviewed: Ultra 100 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have a pair of Dynafit Alpine shoes in a size US 12 and they fit my narrow and pointy foot well. However, the upturned front of this Ultra 100 shoe, combined with a stiff upper due to the Gore Tex lining, made this shoe about a half-size shorter than my Alpine shoes. My toes hit the end. Had I known, I would have ordered these in a 12.5. But Backcountry.com doesn't carry the 12.5, only the 13. I returned them for a refund and purchased a pair of Scarpa trail runners that I hope fit my skinny, narrow feet.
review.name: Solid Shoe/Short Sizing

name: Ultra 100 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: This was a gift for my Son . He and I like to go fishing and camping . I have always loved the Coleman steel belted coolers , so I got one for him for Christmas !
review.name: Ice For Days

review.reviewBody: Great classic look on the patio and keeps beverages cold the entire football weekend!
review.name: Great for tailgating at home!

review.reviewBody: Love it!!! Took it on our first camping trip this summer. Kept everything cold.
review.name: Always wanted this cooler!!!

review.reviewBody: Love the nostalgic look of the cooler, had a dent from shipping process I imagine but not at the fault of Coleman.
review.name: Classic look
comment:
Hello! Thank you for sharing your experience with our Coleman Reunion54-Quart Steel Belted Stainless Steel Cooler.I'm sorry to hear the product did not live up to your expectations. Despite liking the cooler design, you are still unsatisfied because you received a defective item. This is certainly not the experience we want you to have. We always ensure that consumers' feedback and concerns are shared with the concerned department.

For further queries or concerns about your product, you can also visit the Coleman website. Choose “contact us” from the question mark logo in the upper right corner of the page to access our online contact form.

review.reviewBody: Looking for a cooler that would fit inside a jeep and leave space for other stuff. This one is perfect!! Pleased with how long it keeps ice with kids opening it every 5 minutes. My son recommended this one and I’m so glad I purchased it.
review.name: New cooler

review.reviewBody: I bought this cooler and am very disappointed with the Lack of quality control of secondary packaging and/or finished product. I received the cooler with outside torn flaps and a dent on the ice chest cooler lid. Therefore, I cannot comment on the ice chest. I am sending it back.
review.name: Lack of Quality Control with finished product.
comment:
We're unhappy that the cooler you received had a dent on the ice chest cooler lid and ripped exterior flaps. We most certainly don't want you to go through this. As we seek to enhance our products and services, we always make sure to share customer comments and grievances.

You can check the Coleman website if you have any questions or concerns about your product. You can access our contact us web form by selecting "contact us" from the question mark logo in the top right corner of the page.

review.reviewBody: Best cooler!  I bought similar one over 15 years ago and it's still in great condition - just wanted another one.
review.name: 54 quart stainless steel cooler

review.reviewBody: I Have bought this product in the last week and i suggest others to buy this product
review.name: Automation Test

review.reviewBody: I had bought this product in the last week this was good .Thank you
review.name: Automation Newell

review.reviewBody: Classic Coleman holds up and does the job while looking great in the process! I used to have this cooler but had to leave it behind in our last move. I purchased the 54-gallon, silver version before a party weekend and it delivered just in time. We filled it with three bags of ice and a bunch of mini sodas and water. Almost (5) days later, I was asked to bring cold drinks to another school event. I was shocked to find a fully frozen ice bag still in the cooler along with several drinks, still ice cold. I drained the water and carried the cooler with a few more added drinks to the event and it was all perfectly ice cold. Amazing how well this cooler works!!! And it looks great too. :-)
review.name: Classic Coleman Cooler Delivers!!

name: Reunion Steel Belted Cooler - 54qt

review.reviewBody: I’m satisficed with the product
review.name: Excellent!!

review.itemreviewed: Essential Road VPDS Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Nice fitting but very thin poor quality uncomfortable chamois. 1-hour max Bibs. Probably ideal for mountain biking but not suitable for the road. I'm going to try to return them.
review.name: These are 1 hour Bibs

review.itemreviewed: Essential Road VPDS Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I purchased this bib shorts as I wanted to try the POC. Although it fits well, I'm a little concerned about the chamois.  There simply isn't much padding and it looks cheaply made. I'll return with feedback.

Well... I went for a long 87 mile ride (to NYC) today and these shorts were good for the first 35-50 miles.  The last 30+ miles, was a bit uncomfortable in the saddle.  The bib shorts fit fairly nicely, but my fears were confirmed.  I'll probably look at one of the other or more expensive POC bib shorts.
review.name: Nice light bib, but poor chamois quality

review.itemreviewed: Essential Road VPDS Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very nice and very light bib with good compression. I would say runs a tad bit small but you start to forget about it after a few rides. I have a 29 hips and bought small.
review.name: Nice light bib

name: Essential Road VPDS Bib Short - Men's

review.reviewBody: Awesome winter training kit. Regularly run in the teens to 30s and this is perfect. Nice and soft too.
I primarily use this jacket for nordic skiing and have found it to be the perfect lightweight layer for activities requiring high exertion.
review.name: Great jacket!

review.reviewBody: but I returned it...because I need a rip-stop nylon material as I regularly hike through areas with burrs.. Rip Cockle-burrs do not stick to rip-stop.
review.name: Great jacket, but I returned it

review.reviewBody: It is a great jacket to have at all times. Perfect in a city environment going in and out of buildings all day. Also works great for camping or hiking as you don't get too hot while moving around in it. If you're sitting still would want to layer it up with something else as well.
review.name: Extremely Light Weight and Warm

review.reviewBody: Nice piece, weird fit (for me). I am 5'11, 165 lb. and the medium is too tight in the chest, too short in the arms, and too short in the waist. Not even close. Returned, bummer.
review.name: Nice piece, weird fit

review.reviewBody: I love this jacket. I live in Colorado and bought it for cold weather running and it’s been great. Warm and still breathes well. I’ve worn it with a warm base layer as cold as 10F and been comfortable running. Very comfortable too. My only complaint is that the sleeves are a little long.
review.name: Seriously great jacket

review.reviewBody:
The Outdoor Research Deviator Hoodie exceeded expectations during my recent 6-mile run in 24-degree Fahrenheit weather. Despite the cold, the hoodie, paired with a single polyester t-shirt, kept me comfortably warm throughout the run. The fabric's ability to regulate temperature was impressive, as I noticed a slight chill when pausing for photos but quickly warmed up again once I resumed movement. The hoodie's design also proved practical, with a spacious chest pocket securely holding my Samsung S22 Ultra and deep lower pockets providing warmth for my hands. The medium size fit perfectly, ensuring optimal comfort and performance. For those who tend to run warm, the Deviator Hoodie is an excellent choice for cold-weather activities, offering a balance of warmth and breathability without feeling bulky or restrictive.

 I found the combination of hood and beanie to be excessive once I fully warmed up. However, the hood itself is well-designed and provides a snug, comfortable fit without restricting movement or vision. For those seeking a versatile and well-fitting hoodie for cold-weather activities, the Deviator Hoodie is a solid choice.

Reference:
5'6, 175, Chest roughly 38" , size: M
review.name: Solid Cold Weather Hoodie

review.reviewBody: very nice hoodie, more waterproof that I thought (light mist was not making it all wet). very warm for being this light and extremely breathable!
review.name: light and warm

review.reviewBody: I use this Jacket from light ski touring to a shell for early morning runs to a quick jaunt around town. I've had this Jacket for three months and had to wash it after almost every use due to the smell that is retained in the Jacket. I've had plenty of other soft shell jackets that have not had to be washed near as often, even after heavier. multi-day use. While I love the fleece on the inside for warmth and comfort, this jacket is not living up to my expectation as an everyday use jacket. Heaven forbid I visit a friends place after an activity, or they visit my house before I can wash the jacket. Great concept, poor delivery for use.
review.name: Boy does this thing retain smells

review.reviewBody: This thing rocks. Originally, I purchased this to do winter trail runs in, but have since used it to paddle, ice climb, mountain bike, backpack, and travel. I have found the Deviator to be one of the best if not the best light, active piece for me when it is chilly outside. The front/hood fabric has a good DWR and sheds light wind/rain well, while keeping just the right amount of heat in. I have found that it needs to be under 25F while running to keep myself from sweating, but with the other activities, I find it to be very comfortable in the 30-45F range (when I am moving), even if it is windy. The zippers are a little fragile, BUT it is meant to be a lightweight piece. I have found that being patient with and keeping the zippers clean and waxed go a long way. I am a Medium/Large and bought a medium, which worked for me well. Overall, I love this piece. While it is not a replacement for a puffy, It retains way more heat than I expected for such a light jacket, especially when moving.
review.name: A very versatile active layer

name: Deviator Hoodie - Men's

review.reviewBody: Honestly the best carabiner for racking and alpines. The nose never gets snagged on anything, and I love how lightweight they are. Prefect addition to my rack.
review.name: Best racking carabiner

review.reviewBody: Still bought a bunch despite those colors... By far the easiest handling and most fun to use biner I have found. Worth the price. Gate action is superb. Super light with a very satisfying positive click. Easiest biner to clip a rope into. Great for both racking and alpine draws. 2 downsides. 1. Fat nose makes it hard to do things like unlock an atc in guide mode. 2. The colors. For the love of god please fix this. The colors are super desaturated in real life and only the silver biner matches any other piece of gear. Best biner but is one of there worst looking. How cruel!
review.name: Best biner by a large margin

review.reviewBody: This is my new favorite carabiner for racking cams. Weighs roughly 14g heavier than a BD MiniWire (making it about 37% heavier), but that difference is outweighed by the larger, easier to handle size, the slightly larger gate opening, and the bent gate shape. Comes in all the colors you'd need for your rack.

For its size, this really is the lightest and best handling carabiner for trad and sport climbing.  My first priority is to lighten my rack, starting with my collection of carabiners.  It's a splurge to fill your rack with "color-coded" Helium biners, but considering how long they will last, it is a worthwhile investment.  And for my rack of light weight locking carabiners, I am a longtime devotee of the highly-rated "Petzl Attache 3D Screw-Lock."
review.name: Lightest & Best Handling Trad Carabiner

review.reviewBody: Hard to put into words why I like these so much, they just feel the best to clip and they handle really nicely.
review.name: My favorite "feel"

review.reviewBody: One of the best wiregate carabiners ever made.  The only detractors is the wide nose that doesn’t fit very well when clipping pitons.  Everything else is fantastic.  Wide gate, great strength and light!
Good size for gloved use. I love the snag free nose, but wish it was just a bit narrower for getting into tight spots like chains or crowded bolt hangers.

name: Helium 3.0 Carabiner

review.itemreviewed: 125 ZoneKnit Merino Energy Wind Cropped Bra-Tank - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Not itchy at all, love it as a sports bra or a crop top. Usually I am a medium in fitted tops and sports bras, but had to return and size up to a large. I am an A/B cup with 36" band for reference.
review.name: Love the fit

review.itemreviewed: 125 ZoneKnit Merino Energy Wind Cropped Bra-Tank - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I absolutely love this top... except for the ugly and obnoxious logo in a contrasting color (white on black) right in the front center of your chest. I wear IB because it transitions seamlessly from activewear to casual wear. However, the logo screams "workout top" and makes this top unwearable for anything else. IB has added their logo in contrast colors to nearly everything this year (always from/center) and I've passed on buying SO many items as a result. Sad. I even tried steaming the logo off (it is NOT removable), and then I colored the white in with a Sharpie (it turned light purple in the wash so I'll have to re-color it every wash). I checked the new version of this top and now the logo is EMBROIDERED so it will probably itch. It's a shame since this top is absolute perfection otherwise. 34B slim on top and medium fits me well. The bra band is a bit tight but loosens slightly with wear, and it's encased in merino (yay!) . Comes with bra inserts. It's the perfect cropped length to wear with high waist leggings. Please get rid of the logo!
review.name: LOVE the top, HATE the logo

review.itemreviewed: 125 ZoneKnit Merino Energy Wind Cropped Bra-Tank - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My search for a wool/wool blend sports bra continues. Ditch the built in bra and removable cups, cloying and uncomfortable.
review.name: Disappointing

review.itemreviewed: 125 ZoneKnit Merino Energy Wind Cropped Bra-Tank - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this top. Can wear it to work out or just running errands. So comfy! I'll be buying more!
review.name: So comfy

review.itemreviewed: 125 ZoneKnit Merino Energy Wind Cropped Bra-Tank - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] You can immediately tell this top is well made. The fabric is soft and the color is vibrant. I bought a similar style years ago and it looks new. The neckline and slight crop is super flattering.
review.name: Incredible quality and comfort

name: 125 ZoneKnit Merino Energy Wind Cropped Bra-Tank - Women's

review.reviewBody: I wore this on a snow backpacking trip on mount shasta. It held up great over two days with 2 ft of falling snow! Only gripe is that it has no pit vents... for the price, seems like a big omission.
review.name: Great shell layer! Just wish it had vents

review.reviewBody: Love this jacket! Very light weight, lovely color, kept me warm and the heavy winds didn't sip thru.
review.name: Very light weight, lovely color, kept me warm

review.reviewBody: I was disappointed in the fit. Following previous comments that it runs small, I ordered a size up. Still too small around the hips but the arm length was far too long -  even if the rest of it fit, I would have had to return it. The return process was also cumbersome, having to contact customer service a few times to get a printable label.
review.name: Sizing

review.reviewBody: This jacket does everything for me. It's my lightweight rain jacket and also my ski touring jacket. It's durable but also breathes. It fits me just right, 5'8", 150 woman wearing size medium.
review.name: The everything jacket

review.reviewBody: I bought this with the intention of it being my main backcountry ski jacket, and not for rain so I can't comment on how well it is waterproof. But personally, it is somewhat of a heavy jacket for rainy warm weather. I loved it today in zero temps with a thin fleece hoody and wool shirt on underneath. I was a little concerned about how the stiff, tall collar would feel on my face, but it was great coverage and roomy enough so my neck gator fit underneath it just fine. I sized up in this jacket because I need to layer and went with XL which meant it was fairly long and covered my bum, but still surprisingly close fitting around the hips which is common for me in OR tops. It is a great weight for cold backcountry ski days, lighter than my older OR Skytour shell but heavier than the Motive. I am posting a photo. Love the color too. In the photo I also have on the insulated Snowcrew ski pants which were toasty on this bitter cold day!
review.name: Runs small but otherwise great!

review.reviewBody: Love the jacket and color, nice change from black; I sized up from XS to Small for layering, fits true to size.
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody: Color peeling, only worn once The jacket is breathable and waterproof
review.name: surface color

review.reviewBody: Color peeling, only worn once The jacket is breathable and waterproof
review.name: surface color

review.reviewBody: I wear this rain shell for just about any weather. Haze is such a great color, the pockets are convenient, and it blocks a fair amount of wind. It's super lightweight too!
review.name: Perfect jacket

review.reviewBody: Lightweight, easy to pack and works great in a downpour
review.name: Love this jacket!

review.reviewBody: I upgraded from an old fox chest protector and I have to say it's a night and day difference for comfort.  Very light and form fitting.  Low profile and works great with my hydration pack. Forgot I even had it on while riding. Highly recommend.

review.reviewBody: 12 yr old......very small

review.reviewBody: I like Nitro as a company, but the kids' boots run Incredibly small, my son wears a size 2.5 shoe and a 5 was still tight.  They are also very bulky which makes them extremely hard to strap in.
review.name: Kids Droid BOA Snowboard Boot

review.reviewBody: I order one size larger and they are still too small for my kiddo.
review.name: Way too small

review.reviewBody:
I ordered US size 2.5 for my daughter. The Mondo size was 20.5 for the Nitro Droid BOA US 2.5. But I took out the liner to see how big it is, and it's the same length as a pair of toddler size 12 mary janes. (I attached a photo) I always order up a couple of sizes for my daughter because her feet are wide and picky, but for these I'd have to order up 3-4 sizes for them to fit her. Right now she wears street shoe size 13ish, and the 2.5 made her toes curl. On top of that, it didn't hold her heel in, so I don't think these are the right boots for her. 

Luckily the size 2 Thirty Two boots I also ordered actually fit with room (they're a mondo size 21, which bigger than the Nitro even though the US size is smaller) so we will go with those. She says those hold her heels in too. To compare, she wore the Burton Junior Grom BOA last season in size 1 (but with the room to grow insert taken out, so essentially a size 2 according to Burton) and those probably fit similar to the Nitro 2.5. These are tiny.

They look quite cute though.
review.name: They run tiny!

name: Droid BOA Snowboard Boot - 2022 - Kids'

review.reviewBody:
I  expect and new condition product when ordering for Backcountry.  The helmet came in a "new" like condition, but the box busted, cardboard tabs out of place.  All attached tags were removed and the product was in a hot mess, clearly the item was previously returned.   Not the quality I'm expecting when paying $200 for a helmet.

Nothing wrong with the helmet or the iXS brand, but just plain carelessness on Backcountry on handling and reselling returned items. They don't have the decency to inspect and repackage returned items neatly.
review.name: Beware of used and returned item.....

review.reviewBody:
The helmet is well constructed, comfortable, and breathable. it would have been nice if there had been a S, M, and L individually rather than the S/M and M/L options. I wear a M in Smith, Kask, Lazer, and Abus, so I went with the S/M. This was a bit on the tight side. Other than the sizing, the helmet is wonderful. Great coverage and plenty of venting. I would recommend this with other top brands in the category for sure. 

+++++UPDATE+++++
i adjusted the cradle on the back of the helmet and now it fits beautifully. changing my score from 4 stars to 5 stars.
review.name: great helmet

name: Trigger AM Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody: Haven't skied with them yet, but this is my 3rd pair from Leki. Had metal shafts before but like the swing weight of the graphite shaft and the grip release is an improvement. Hope to not leave this pair in a parking lot!
review.name: Leki poles keep hetting better

review.reviewBody: Not happy with what I received. The new poles were to replace my carbon 6.0 that were broken in a fall. The advertisement implied they were carbon, they are aluminum. They were not what I expected
review.name: Not happy
comment: Thank you for your review, Allan. If you received aluminum poles instead of the Carbon 14 you ordered, don't hesitate to contact our customer service team for an exchange. We want to make sure you received the correct poles. They will need a photo of the poles you received in order to make an exchange but it should be an easy fix. We apologize for any inconvenience.

review.reviewBody: Poles are great - lightweight, strong. Maybe a little too easy to disconnect the strap from the pole when you don't intend to with just normal handling. Immediately lost a strap on the first lift ride just carrying the poles so I'm here to spend almost 1/3 of the cost again to replace them. Good times! So definitely make sure you're all set up before you go leave the house - the straps don't reliably stay attached to the poles, only to you.
review.name: Immediately lost strap

review.reviewBody: These poles are light and strong, and the attachment system is easy and awesome.
review.name: Great poles!

review.reviewBody: Super light and love the trigger grip…..easy on and off!
review.name: Everything you want in a pole (trigger grip) and nothing you don’t (weight).

review.reviewBody:
Outstanding ski poles. I am a ski instructor and these are my third pair of Leki carbon poles.  I bought them originally for ease of use.  They clip on and off easily and there's no messing around with straps as you try to get on or off the lifts.  My first pair lasted almost 12 years of heavy use and abuse. They have been used as a teaching tool, skied over, used to help stop runaway skiers, slammed in the trunk, etc. 
I now own two pairs in different lengths depending on skiing conditions. (Leki does make an adjustable length pole but they are aluminum).  So, if you are looking for an ultra lightweight and durable pole that is much quicker to take on and off -- this is the one.
review.name: Easy to use, high performance poles

review.reviewBody: Thanks for getting them to me quickly. My other poles were stolen and you got me taken care of without missing a beat.
review.name: Replaced my poles mid season

review.reviewBody: Great poles, as expected, and the new retention system is a big improvement over the previous method.
review.name: New poles

review.reviewBody: Love my Leki poles, lightweight, great quality!  Took a while to get used to the clip on grips but I got I now!
review.name: Love my new poles

review.reviewBody: Excellent poles. Great strap system, light weight. I would buy again
review.name: Excellent poles. I would buy again

name: Carbon 14 3D Ski Poles

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Full-Zip Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have worn Medium across every brand for the last 20 years and the medium vigor fleece I received from Backcountry was the tightest fitting one ever, and I am a thin guy. It was not even near a medium and I could barely zip it up. Pretty disappointed for the price I paid. I've never had this issue with OR or any outdoor brand.
review.name: Super Small

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Full-Zip Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have a couple of these from a few years ago which I wear almost every day. They are comfortable and the fit is perfect! The one I just ordered is even better than the original as I prefer the material and I also think the fit is improved.
review.name: My Favorite Hoodie

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Full-Zip Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Redesign for 2024 is disappointing. I own 3 of these and love them. Thought I'd pick up another one on sale. The new version no longer has YKK zippers, nor the cool reinforced sleeve by the wrists. All of the pockets now have mesh instead of fabric. I understand these production cuts were likely due to inflation, but it is disappointing.
review.name: Not a fan of the redesign

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Full-Zip Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I wanted to love this - I have an old grid fleece piece from another brand but it’s pullover so I wanted a full zip.

But this just didn’t work. The seams and zippers are too robust for the very light and airy fabric, and so it feels clunky. This fabric is amazingly breathable but the zips and seams thing was a dealbreaker. OR puts out lots of great pieces, this one just missed it for me!
review.name: Mismatch if airy fabric and heavy zippers/seams

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Full-Zip Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: The Vigor fleece is a very nice light weight piece of equipment. Worn either  by itself or as a mid layer, it gets the job done. It holds heat and moderates body temperature very well. It has the pockets you need and none that you don't.
review.name: Simple and Effective!

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Full-Zip Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I love this fleece. I had a previous version which I have owned for many years and put it through the wringer, it’s still holding up just fine. I grabbed this new version on sale and have to say it even has several improvements, notably the sleeve cuffs are less bulky and the zippers function more smoothly. Well done OR!
review.name: Favorite fleece for climbing and hiking

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Full-Zip Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: This fleece is amazingly comfortable.   This is my second one.  I'll admit the orange is bright.  I'm definitely noticeable when I hike.
review.name: Can't Go Wrong

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Full-Zip Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great lightweight mid layer. Thumb holes are a plus. I have the pull over also, better for cold weather with high neck coverage.
review.name: Excellent fleece

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Full-Zip Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I like the hoodie as a base/mid layer but it is definitely tight in my shoulders, short in arms. I usually wear a M in comparable items from OR but I should’ve gotten the L. Haven’t gotten out BC skiing yet in it or anything. Works good climbing til I reach up.😉
review.name: Sized a little smaller than comparable OR so go 1 size up!

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Full-Zip Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Fit me great. I wear it on bicycle rides and wear it over a base shirt. Size is perfect. Don't be like dusty stay trim my friends.
review.name: great hoody for dusty trail rides

name: Vigor Grid Fleece Full-Zip Hooded Jacket - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam X Hierro v7 Wide Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Fresh Foam Hierro is my all time favourite running shoe. With a need for stability shoes to accomodate my wide feet, New Balance is always my go to when it comes to running shoes. I used to run exclusively in 680s but made the switch to Hierro last year. It was the best decision. They are super supportive with the Vibram shock absorption and even after 15kms of running each week for the past year - they've still held up well - they last so long and are super durable. Hope the Hierro will always be a mainstay because this will be my go to running shoes from now on.
review.name: Perfect running shoe

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam X Hierro v7 Wide Trail Running Shoe - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam X Hierro v7 Wide Trail Running Shoe - Men's

review.name: Weight loss upgrade

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam X Hierro v7 Wide Trail Running Shoe - Men's

They are impressively durable and I've been tracking down the hard to find wide fit versions to have a pair or two ready for when these die because I love them so much.

review.reviewBody: I bought an Exos 48 to downsize and reduce from my Aether 65. I’ve been on two 7 day treks and it’s worked out perfectly for less than 30 lbs loads even with a bear vault. I’m 71 and trying to extend my backpacking days with lighter loads. This pack is versatile as well. I intend to use it for 15ish lbs load on an Alta Via 1 hut-to-hut hike on over 11 days in Italy this fall. Highly recommend.
review.name: Great downsizer

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I’ve taken it on a 4 day 3 night hiking trip to Mt Rogers in Virginia, and I can truthfully say the pack did everything as advertised.. Thanks
review.name: I’ve taken it on a

review.reviewBody: I have the Exos from like 7 years ago, I think 2 or 3 models ago. The ones that came out after my version had a mix of materials for the side and front stretch pockets. Mine is all stretch mesh which I prefer. I also have the hip belt pockets but I think they are smaller than the pockets on this new version. I am very happy with my Exos and love the vented back panel and having the option to remove the brain/lid to make it a smaller bag when needed. I have even used it as a day bag when the brain is removed. If you are on the fence between this 48L and the 38L, look at the dimensions, this one is only an inch wider. I am sure there are improvements on this new model but I am really happy with my old version. If you aren't someone that counts every ounce possible, this is a great pack. It is in a good price range for all you get with this bag. It is lighter than most packs in it's size range, has a lot of external storage pockets, internal frame, and has the best ventilated back panel I have used.
review.name: Awesome Pack but Prefer the Old One

name: Exos 48L Backpack

hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Exos Pro 55L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
The toggles on the new torso adjustment system keeps popping off on my back, when putting on the pack and when taking it off. Seems like a common complaint (google it). Returned the item got a refund which was nice. 

Also hate the one zipper-less side pocket. You still need two hands to get stuff out of it so why bother taking out the zips?

Nice and light though, but that
review.name: Bad torso adjustment and pocket design

review.reviewBody: I bought the Exos Pro 55 last September, used it for multiple Fall trips in the Sierras, and loved it! At barely over 2 lbs, it's a real ultralight pack. With its frame, it really does hold the weight well, even up to 30 lbs though I usually carry less. The mesh back panel keeps me cool, and the whole pack fits like a glove. I've had no sore spots at all. It's light enough to use as my summit pack, too, after removing the top lid (2.6 oz). My iPhone 13 fits fine in the hip belt pocket, and the side pockets keep my water bottles secure. I've taken it through miles of trees, bushes, scrambling over boulders, etc... and the material has held up well. No tears at all. There's nothing I don't like about this pack. At 55L, it's plenty large for multi-day trips. I'm so glad Osprey came out with this improvement to the Exos series (I also own an Exos 58, but like the Pro 55 much better).
review.name: Close to Perfection!

review.reviewBody:
I switched from the Exos 58 (M) to the Exos Pro 55 (S/M) - I've had this pack for just over 9 months and really like that it's a lighter and easier to pack than the Exos 58 but am surprised by the updates as several are a step backwards and unnecessary (as they're not weight saving) - compression straps are on top of the side pockets, limiting pocket usability; attaching compression straps limits access to the front stuff pocket; the side pockets aren't waterproof and hold rainwater; the zipper belt pocket cannot be opened & closed one-handed; they removed the extra (underside) brain pocket; the base of the backpack needs thicker material; the toggles to adjust shoulder straps dislodge regularly when taking the packing on & off. I'm also not a fan of the new Osprey sizing as I have a 20.5" torso - at the cusp of being too big for the S/M, but the L/XL was huge on me and sat way too high!

Hoping that Osprey fixes these for the next generation of Exos Pro (as most were already on the Exos 58!)
review.name: Good ultralight backpack, but has some big flaws

review.reviewBody: I purchased this pack in March 2023 and have taken it on multi day trips, as well as overnighters. Pros: No problem carrying my gear and food for a week, plus food for a dog. It's comfortable, light and breathable. Love the hip pocket without the zipper. Perfect for quick snacks. Cons: the edge seam running horizontal across the top of the large, stretchy pocket on the outside of the pack is starting to fray. This area has not gotten a lot of rubbing or abuse. It generally holds a visor. Also, the small toggle type fasteners that allow you to adjust the pack length came out of the slot a couple times when taking off or putting on the pack. I ended up taping them.
review.name: Great pack

name: Exos Pro 55L Backpack

review.itemreviewed: Terrex Soulstride Ultra Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Adidas Terrex Soulstride Ultra provide me comfort, and versatility and durability 

Here’s a breakdown  based on my experience:

Performance on the Trail
	•	Smooth Ride: The shoe’s design excels at rolling through varied terrain, providing a natural, supported stride.
	•	Supportive Fit: It offers excellent foot and ankle support, making it reliable for uneven and technical trails.

Fit and Break-In
	•	Great Width: The fit accommodates wider feet comfortably, reducing pressure and enhancing stability.
	•	Quick Break-In: The materials adapt to your feet rapidly, so they feel ready for action right out of the box.

Cushioning and Comfort
	•	Plush Cushioning: kept me you comfortable over a long distances and through rough terrain.
	•	Versatility: Its design works equally well on a range of trail types, from compact dirt paths to loose, rocky surfaces.
review.name: Most comfortable trail shoe!

review.reviewBody: I love this jacket light weight withstand the rain excellent w as keeps me warn and looks great get compliments every time I wear it .. Great for snowshoeing and Mountain biking love it
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody:
I accidentally ordered the wrong size and had to return this jacket.
However I liked the color and the long length. The hood was well designed. There are enough pockets just no wrist pocket.
review.name: Nice jacket

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket online in a size small so I could not try it on first. I already own an OR Aspire Gore-Tex jacket in size small and it fits okay thru the chest. I use the Aspire as a rain jacket in mild and warm temps so I rarely wear an insulating layer under it. This Carbide jacket is too snug in the chest so it is not possible to wear an insulating layer underneath it. I bought the Carbide jacket to wear during the cold, snowy winter months in Michigan. I will have to return it. Apparently OR has changed their size dimensions in recent years so a size small no longer fits me properly. I am 5'4" and 115 pounds. Be forewarned: this Carbide jacket is NOT a "standard fit" but rather a "slim fit". Also, the front zipper is difficult to fit into the slot at the bottom so it takes several attempts to get it started so you can zip this jacket up. I would have loved wearing this stylish jacket to snowshoe and hike had it fit me properly as the pretty green color is one of my favorite colors.
review.name: Runs Tight in the Chest

review.reviewBody: Best fitting coat I've ever had!
review.name: Love this coat

review.reviewBody: I did a ton of research before selecting the Carbide jacket. I had to go up a size, the medium was smaller than expected, but I love the fit of the large! So many great pockets on this. The main zipper does take some effort and is not smooth. I've worn this skiing twice in really really cold weather (insulated jacket under) and I've been perfectly comfortable. I love the color, I got the lilac. I usually go with black because I don't want dirt to show, but I'm so happy with the purple. The hood cinches are all great for modifying with or without a ski helmet. Also love the premium features like the snow skirt and armpit zips. This will be perfect for year-round use. I'm so happy with my purchase.
review.name: Perfect shell

review.reviewBody: I bought this shell to match my carbide bib and I love it! I'm 5'5 115lbs and the XS is a tailored fit while still roomy enough to layer up with a fleece and thick puffy jacket. This jacket is light and would be great on its own for spring skiing. Taped seams, good ventilation, and lots of quality details. The tree line colour is beautiful and I've had so many compliments at the resorts. I've owned several OR shells over the past few years and this is my favourite! Worth the buy
review.name: Great shell for skiing

review.reviewBody: I like the flexibility and softness of the fabric and the fit is good. Ihave not warn it yet in snowy or rainy conditions but hopefully it will hold up well. I am 5'3" and sleeves are a little longer. Its great OR makes various lengths of pants. It would be nice to have shells and jackets in petite sizes. If they were available OR would not have much competition for the " short" market
review.name: Great looking parka

review.reviewBody: So I'm the basic girl who's always wanted to fit and look good in Flylow gear. I have given up on that all together!! Last year returned a Flylow coat twice for a different size and still wasn't comfortable. I am a girl with bigger hips, thighs, and butt. The outdoor research coat fits my body well as a top layer and goes over my hips without looking tight. In addition, when layering the coat doesn't make me feel like a suffocated marshmallow. I also wear outdoor research bibs, so I knew I was going to be a fan of the non-insulated design, but I really like the thickness of the coat. Sadly, I haven't tested the waterproofness due to lack of snow, but when some flurries came down the coat didn't seem to care. Lastly, the color I'm a big fan of. I was worried it would be too pink, but it's that perfect subdue pink that looks great with my black pants! Overall I'm stoked with OR gear and I'm excited to see what's next!
review.name: The dream jacket

review.reviewBody: I researched so many ski jackets before deciding on this jacket. I have worn it on two ski trips for a total of 12 days of skiing - one ski trip in 2022 and one in 2023. I am an average skier staying in greens and blues. I have not worn this jacket besides those two ski trips as I live in a warm climate. There is so much pilling under the arms and on the back of the jacket. This is not normal wear and tear, especially with this type of fabric. I called customer service and was told this is covered under the "lifetime" warranty. After waiting weeks for a warranty response, turns out OR will not honor their warranty. I was told to wash it inside out (it's barely been worn and doesn't need to be washed), hand wash it, or use a pilling shaver! This is not a washing issue. This is a quality issue. Fabric should not pill this quickly, especially on a jacket that is meant to be worn for outdoor activity. I am so disappointed in this jacket and the lack of warranty.
review.name: Poor quality fabric 0/10 do not recommend

review.reviewBody: Used for inbounds resort skiing. Jacket is lightweight and no bulk with excellent wind/waterproofing. When jacket is fully zipped has a wider collar to accommodate helmet strap, neck gaiter, and other collars without feeling choked. I can wear with a midweight baselayer, 1/4 zip fleece, and thin insulated puffy (eg TNF thermoball or arcteryx Cerium) on an 11 degF day, and it is warmer and less bulk than previous OR insulated ski jacket. I'm 5'2'', 125 lbs, 34B and the XS was ideal arm length, chest width, and hem length (even with all those layers). Also, need to mention bilateral Napolean pockets!
review.name: Solid ski jacket - Excellent layering capacity

review.reviewBody: Originally wasn't too keen on the old So Ill shoes, but the new shoes they introduced caught my interest as it has all new lasts and shapes. To my surprise these shoes turned out to be the best soft fitting aggressive shoe for my Greek feet. Fitting wise theses feel like the Scarpa Instinct VSRs with slightly tighter toe area and heel; widthwise. The toe rubber is a little more relaxed than the VSRs which took a while to break in for the big toe knuckle area. Forefoot area I would say it's about the same as the VSR's. Stiffness wise, they are softish shoes and somewhere between the Evolv Zenists and Instinct VSR. Maybe a little bit stiffer than the Dragos which I've tried in US 9.5. The other shoes in my arsenal are Evolv Shaman, Zenists (US10.5), Instinct VSR(US9.5), UP Moccs (US9).
review.name: A surprisingly solid aggressive shoe

hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Focal 48L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Used on a 40mile trip held up to rain and rough treatment. The bag is very lightweight and took a lot of the load off my back especially uphill.
review.name: Light weight and strong

review.reviewBody:
I have had this pack for a while now - maybe two years? I have put about 350 miles of AT on it. It has performed and held up well. It is a great sub 3lb pack.

The only downside, in my opinion, is the skinny little adjustment straps for load lifters and compression straps. While I don't care for them, I understand weight needs to be cut any way it can be cut. Having said that, I pretty much just set it and forget it so being rather nit-picky.
review.name: Solid lightweight pack

review.reviewBody:
I've been using this pack for a few years, and it's a solid lightweight option under the 3 lb. mark, but could also use some improvements. It carries weight fairly well for when your base weight is low, but you still have to hump 6 days of food and 3 liters of water. However I often do wish the hipbelt had a little thicker padding/structure. Also, sometimes the metal wire frame hits and rubs my back & sides. Speaking of, the wire frame extends to the bottom sides, which is covered by a fabric, which despite being thicker, is showing quite a bit of wear from every time I set the pack down on its bottom. Could use a better design here, perhaps bending the wire frame in to meet behind the lumbar pad. 

The back panel is nice and breathable, but the bottom of it is slick and tends to slide down my back when sweating. Adding the grippy silicone accents to the bottom lumber area (like on the Baltoros) should be a standard feature on all Gregorys. Shoulder straps are fine.

The packbag is simple and straightforward, which I appreciate. Gregory has too many models that all have the same sleeping bag compartment zipper and other access that just add weight and never get used (by me anyway). The fabric is lightweight and has held up well, though doesn't inspire as much confidence as some of their other packs. I really do wish they'd use a better stretch mesh with a tighter weave as the current stuff scuffs through and can snag easily. I've never used the straps across the bottom of the pack, and think those could be cut.  

The Polygiene odor control really works and is so nice to not have a pack smell like trail B.O. when you bring it home. I'm glad the top pocket is removable, but do wish the zipper had a wider (L-shaped) opening. Due to the lighter fabrics and lack of structure opening it is a two-handed affair. 

Lastly, I don't care for the neon blue color accents that make it feel like a little kids school pack. Stick to the classy more monotone or colorblocking, especially that Alaska Blue of the Baltoro. But overall it's been a solid lightweight pack option. Just look forward to a few improvements on the next gen.
review.name: Solid LW option with a few improvements needed

review.reviewBody: This bag was the first Gregory Pack I have tried after using Osprey for years. While this will not replace my bigger Osprey packs, I will be using this pack frequently for one or 2 night trips. The fabric is tough but light, the exterior pouch on the back is very large and stretchy and the hip pockets are awesome! The only complaint I would have is that the system they used to attach a pad or chair to the bottom of your pack is not as secure as a buckle/synch system. It is not the end of the world, especially since the side water bottle holders are capable of holding loads of things...you might just have to pack things a bit differently than some other packs you frequently use. Overall, if you are looking for an budget friendly option to get yourself into more of the ultralight backpacking space, this is a great option and a great pack!
review.name: Great Ultralight option

review.reviewBody: Love my Gregory Focal 48. Been using it all summer and it helped me get my base weight way down. Great synch and release system for the main compartment (other manufacturers take note, that’s how it should be done). Thought I would miss having multiple compartments but there’s a simplicity to having just one. Nylofume bag at the bottom wrapped up for bedding and clothes, everything else on top.  Just have to be mindful when loading each day. Leave rain gear and shorts up top if needed.  Thought the Free Float system was just marketing hype, but I can feel a difference, no more hip soreness (although I’m also carrying less weight) and had good mobility when doing some lite scrambling. Back ventilation and side pockets for Smart water bottles are excellent.  I ditched the brain on the last few trips and again there’s a simplicity to keeping that stuff in a diddy bag instead. The Focal is so easy to open and close it’s no big deal to keep it near the top if you need to get into it. Hip Belt pockets are pretty small, and the pocket under the hip belt pockets for tucking belt straps is fairly useless (I ended up just trimming the belt straps) Overall highly recommended.
review.name: Great Pack if you’re Focused on reducing Weight

review.reviewBody:
I previously experimented with a true UL pack, the HMG SW. I enjoyed the simplistic streamlined design, but I was missing the comfort and features of a more traditional pack. I wanted something that would strike a balance between the two, and the Focal 48 delivered. It’s only a little over half a pound heavier than the HMG, but significantly more comfortable and supportive. I got the basic features back, like mesh back panel, accessible water bottle holders, and a brain, but nothing too excessive like many other traditional packs. 

I took the Focal out on a challenging multi-day trip in southern Utah, and it performed great. Carried like a champ, held everything I needed, and felt very intuitive to use. Not to mention, the pack looks awesome.  

For those choosing between the 48l and 58l, I have a base weight around 16 lbs. My gear is mostly lightweight and packable, and with a good amount of food, I had plenty of room leftover in the 48L.

For sizing reference, I’m 6 feet, 32 inch waist, 21 inch torso and the medium size fits great. 

This pack is a home run from Gregory!
review.name: Perfectly balanced

review.reviewBody: the hydration pack sleeve has a hook above it which is not compatible with anything other then gregory's own hydration pack.
review.name: why 3DHydro?

review.reviewBody:
The good: Lightweight, fits me well, side pocket that points forward to allow placing water bottle without taking backpack off.
Improvement: Could use front zip opening like the Zulu, Side pocket not so easy to access when pack is on, Belt pockets seem set back more compared to Zulu (for accessibility), no rain cover.
review.name: Good but can use some improvements

review.reviewBody:
Not ULTRA-light, but still pretty lightweight, AND includes all the features you need for a great backpacking pack. Comfortable suspension with a ton of breathability. Well-thought out external side pockets. Carries a stable load that is neither too high, nor wide. 
I’m not a huge fan of the Gregory-only water bladder system, but I use water bottles 99% of the time, so not a big deal for me. 
I like this pack so much, we bought the women’s version (Facet 45) for my wife.
review.name: A great combination of features

review.reviewBody: Over-all I was pleased with the pack. I do run into an issue being tall and thin, which means inevitably the waist strap is as tight as it gets, but I get that with every pack.
review.name: Solid pack

name: Focal 48L Backpack

review.reviewBody: Having used Motorex lubes for years on my KTM's, I bought this lube with the intent of utilizing it for light road lube.  Big mistake.  This lube is better suited to offroad use as it requires dust to cling to it and pull it off the drivetrain, similar to Dumonde Tech lubes.  If you use it on your road bike, it leaves a grinding film on the chain that basically ruins the entire drivetrain by creating a gritty paste. Even wiping this lube after application and after rides, it does not come off.  It cost me two Dura Ace chains and cassettes to learn the hard way.  Steer clear if you're planning on using this for road.  Can't speak to it's offroad use, but should perform similar to Dumonde Tech regular lube.
review.name: Not Road Lube

name: Dry Power Lube

Doesn’t seem super sturdy so I would recommend still bringing climbing shoes for the climbs and hiking shoes for the hikes. Nice shoe all around tho for the in between activities.
review.name: Great shoe

review.reviewBody: Really solid shoe, great grip and stiff enough to do some mild/moderate edging. Solid enough shoe to even do some mild trail running if you're like me and on enough of a budget to not have both haha.
review.name: Great Shoe

review.reviewBody: Just spent a week in the Winds and this shoe was comfortable for the 15 mile hike in and performed well on the approaches and descents through steep slabs, scree and talus fields.
review.name: Great Shoe

review.reviewBody: Great, lightweight
review.name: Approach Shoes

review.reviewBody: Excellent approach shoe.  I have a slightly narrow foot and the fit is perfect.  very sticky rubber that is holding up well after several months of wear.  Comfortable enough for everyday wear.
Super well-built and sticky. Used mostly for long day hikes but comfortable enough to wear anywhere. They do run a bit on the small size.
review.name: Solid

review.reviewBody: It took me a while to hop on the approach shoe train, I felt like my trail running shoes functioned fine in any situation where I would use them.  I ordered a size 9, usually wear a size 9.5, and wow the security these provide on approaches and scrambles is game changing.  I like the tight fit, and they're still comfortable to wear after moving around in them all day.  Not to mention they just look sweet.  Definitely recommend these shoes!
review.name: Favorite Approach Shoe

review.reviewBody: I'm a 10.5-11 depending on the shoe. Went for an 11 and it fits great with some room in the toe for walking downhill and not jamming your toes into the front. Great grip and they did dry much faster than my wives hiking shoes after we did some wet canyoneering in Zion.
review.name: Good Technical Shoe

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Vetiver Arch Rock hat color in every picture I've found on the web is the same. It appears to be an almost bone light with a tinge of light green. The Vetiver Arch Cap I received is NOT that color. It's very well made, the material is lightweight and perfect. I'm keeping the cap because it's nice, I like it, but come on Marmot, take accurate color photos of your clothing! I'm going to click 'Yes' I recommend this product, HOWEVER if you're expecting the color you see online, it's not the color you'll receive. See my photo.
review.name: Vetiver color waaay off...
comment:
Hello,
Thank you for providing us with feedback on color of this hat. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.

I am very sorry that the color was not what it seemed to be on the website.

We will make sure to forward your feedback to an appropriate department, so that we may think about an appropriate solution for the future. Thank you so much for sharing your insights with us.

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via [URL-https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us] or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon.-Fri. 9am-5pm Eastern Time.
Thank you! Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: This is a thin vest, however it's very warm. It fits pretty much true to size and fits an athletic build well. Packable this vest is versatile and can be used for technical and everyday use.
review.name: Warmth without bulk

review.reviewBody: Its honestly perfect for what I needed. Its very light, I think the color looks great with blacks and Navy's. The packing into its own pocket feature is handy so I always carry it with me and it does a significant difference in warmth
review.name: Perfect extra warmth piece to carry

review.reviewBody:
I do like this vest. It is lightweight but provides some warmth for cool days.  It is also quite packable.  The vest is not insulated enough for super cold days, but for me it works best in the 30's and 40's (F). The black looks nice and can even be worn as casual wear. I wish it had a drawstring on the bottom to cinch it tight around the waist to keep in the warmth. And a chest pocket would also be nice. However, overall it's a nice basic vest that feels well made. 

NOTE WELL: the sizing of this vest is off. I usually wear a large in Outdoor Research clothing (which I have much of!). However, this large fits like an extra-large.  So I had to do an exchange to get a medium. It's not the end of the world, but it's slightly frustrating.
review.name: Great Vest; Runs Big

review.reviewBody: Great vest for backpacking. Very light and packable. It generally runs similar in size to the SuperStrand hoodie but it's a bit longer than the jacket. Perhaps it's just how it fits me. Regardless, it's a great mid layer or even an outer layer depending on the temps.
review.name: Good vest - light, warm, and packable

review.reviewBody: I wear this everyday for all activities. I love it!
review.name: Awesome vest

review.reviewBody: I use it for Alpine and Backcountry skiing. It is perfect to pack and is unbelievably warm. Protects from wind and with a good base layer does everything I need it. It is also stylish enough to wear apres ski. I have not used it for other sports yet, but I can see it also being perfect for early morning mountain biking and hiking. I love this vest!
review.name: Perfect for skiing/boarding, mountain biking and hiking!

review.reviewBody: Just that extra touch of warmth maybe a little bit more and without the bulk. Its feather light. Needs a chest pocket but zippers and extra material add weight I get it. Glad I purchased this vest as it is easily a quick grab go to especially with the mild winter so far in the PNW. It will be with me every time I am carrying a day pack as well while skiing.
review.name: another keeper piece from Outdoor Research

review.reviewBody: Bought this to replace an old Patagonia puffball vest, couldn't find any Nano puffs in stock and this was my second option. I'm very happy with this piece, super light, packs down very small and is surprisingly warm for how thin it is. Great for days when I don't want to pack a full puffy but want something I can throw under a shell just in case I get a bit chilled, and it takes up no space in an alpine pack or even a running vest. I'm 6' - 170lbs and a medium fits perfectly.
review.name: Superstrand LT vest

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Just purchased the Superstrand LT vest. Absolutely love it. It's weightless and I forget I am wearing it!
review.name: Super lightweight and warm!

review.reviewBody: I can think of use cases for this vest because it is very lightweight, but I have to strain to think of them. It is light in weight, but it adds very minimal warmth, degraded even further by the lack of sealing around the arm holes and waist. I believe the SuperStrand is marketed as an alternative to down, but with the amount of insulation actually present, that is a ridiculous comparison. The insulation in this jacket appears to be comprised of a single, very thin sheet. (I have a down jacket of about the same weight that is perhaps 5 to 10 times warmer.) Pro's ----- Very light (around 6 oz) Very thin Easy to wear under another layer because it is very thin and also doesn't have sleeves Takes up minimal space when compressed Interior drop pockets on each side Hand pockets feel soft Con's ----- Very little insulation (almost no loft) No elastic or seal mechanism around arm holes: heat loss. Best to wear a jacket over it to encourage sealing No drawcord or elastic around waist Would like it a two inches shorter in front so it doesn't bunch up when sitting Hand pockets blocked by backpack waist belt No chest pocket(s) Fabric is non-breathable Sizing: I think Outdoor Research sizing tends to run large compared to other outdoor brands.
review.name: Don't believe the hype

review.reviewBody: They look great.   Stylish, well crafted, heavy-duty lug sole, a little heavy, high quality.  They have a very interesting and secure magnetic latch that binds the straps together.  A possible problem for me is the latch (where the red tab is) has a sturdy flat plastic bit (fyi, a leather bit rests between the plastic bit and the skin) about an inch wide and 1.5 inch long that hits the cupola of my foot very close to my ankle on one foot in a firm and slightly uncomfortable way.  Not sure how it will break in because its a solid plastic hardware bit.  Maybe if the strap it attaches too were longer so it could slide more to the side, rather than it being on top of the highest point of my foot?  But wow, it's a  good looking shoe and feels amazing otherwise.  Im still testing it/deciding.  I really like everything else about the shoes.
review.name: Might have to keep them...

name: Joseph Leather Sandal - Women's

review.reviewBody: the bag design is good, has a lot of feature, there are two small design issues though. First, it doesn't have chest strap, which is very basic feature that many cheap bags have. Second, it does not stand on even though it is fully loaded.
review.name: good but not great

review.reviewBody:
Overall great quality and functionality. 
Took on work trip and also used for trekking. 
I am 5’10”. It’s medium size and sits mid to upper back. 
Handle and luggage strap great for flights. 
Expandable section holds a sweater or rain jacket.  Considerations for next model- the outer pocket could zip lower to give better access; chest buckle to distribute weigh. 
Would buy again.
review.name: Great all purpose bag

review.reviewBody: I wish the bottom was flatter so that it didn’t fall over when I put it down,
review.name: Not as good as I expected.

review.reviewBody: This is the best travel backpack ever.  So many different compartments which is great. It's not bulky and my laptop and iPad fit great with room for other items.  Great looking, great construction and high quality design.
review.name: Traveler Backpack

review.reviewBody: Thule bags are always made with great quality and detail. Love the bag. Just received it. I'll update the review as I use it. Love at first site. It replaced another branded bag I've used for a long time. The style, the storage, and the size and suprisingly really light.
review.name: The 2nd Backpack I've picked up after a long time!

review.reviewBody:
I recently bought the Construct 24L backpack and it’s great, it’s very well made, the back padding is comfortable as are the straps, the internal compartments provide great protection for my laptop and iPad but some of the features are just not up to the way they are promoted in the descriptions. The divider between the main body of the bag and front pocket is supposed to be able to hold a jacket. It’s simply too small unless you are probably an Extra Small size. Even then if you managed to get a jacket in the space you compress the rest of the main body that you can’t get anything in the main body. the front pocket has no stretch to it so it is very difficult to get a hand into it if anything is at the bottom of the pocket. 

Should I have bought the 28L version? Probably as the 24L is just too small it has become a very utilitarian backpack due to its design.
review.name: Great bag in so many ways, but……..

name: Construct 24L Backpack

description: Buy the Osprey Packs Siskin 12L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Siskin 12L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Siskin 12L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: At 5'10 and 133lbs, I was in search of a backpack that properly fit my long back that I could use for cycling and hiking. The Backcountry team suggested this bag and fits perfectly and I LOVE the moss green color, super cute! Very lightweight and carries everything I need.
review.name: perfect for tall women

review.reviewBody: I previously have been using an older CamelBak Lobo, which works well but has minimal gear storage space, and I needed something bigger for road trips or longer rides. This pack is of excellent quality, you can tell it was designed specifically for mountain bikers. It has enough room for any tools I need to carry, plus holds an extra layer, snacks and my camera gear. The magnetic clip holds well; I've never had the bite valve break loose yet. I run a gimbal and GoPro on my chest while biking, and I was concerned about the magnets being too close to the gimbal and messing up the electronics inside it, but the sternum strap sits way higher up on the chest than I thought it would, so this isn't an issue at all. A little pricey compared to larger, non-biking specific packs from Osprey, but it's worth it, as this pack sits tight on your back, doesn't get in the way, and doesn't move around much unless the trails get really rowdy.
review.name: Great Bike-Specific Features

review.reviewBody: I wear this style of pant almost exclusively; Moutain Khaki, Hardware, Carhartt, etc and these might be my favorite.  I wear Kavu shorts so I knew to swing a size up (normally a 36 but I ordered 38).  They are slightly too big but that’s what I expected as a 36 would’ve been too small. The cool thing about these pants other than the accent color of the corner reinforcements is the extra layer of material on the knee is open at the top making another pocket on both thighs.  Overall 👍👍

review.reviewBody: I really like these pants, they are heavy enough to keep you warm on a cooler day, but not hot. I also like the minimal logo and simplicity of these, wear them most days.
review.name: Really great Pants (1 year review)

review.reviewBody: Great pant for all around use. Handles varying terrain well in how it manages body temp as well as stands up to rocks scratching against it.
review.name: Great Mountaineering Pants

review.reviewBody: These pants are well made but they are not a Slim Fit. They felt like I was wearing Bellbottoms from the 70’s. I don’t know what MH is thinking that these are a Slim Fit. The material is heavy duty and good quality but Way to Big All Around. MH needs to update the fit on these pants. I returned mine.
review.name: Not Slim Pants

review.reviewBody: Great, Durable Softshell pant that holds up to extreme wear. Perfect pockets for use with a harness, Low profile waist adjust works well under a harness also. Repels water and drys quickly. I haven't experienced any issues with these pants and Ive put them through the wringer. Waist 34 and a large was good.
review.name: Awesome soft-shell

review.reviewBody:
Good quality material and constructions but unfortunately poor design flaws.  

There is a snap that pops open with the slightest pressure on the waist band.  Potentially making for a very embarrassing situation. 

There are no belt loops to back up the incorporated waist band tie. 

I am 6ft, 183lbs and usually wear 32 waist and I have a runners build.  These fit skin tight across the hips and thighs.  Putting a pair of soft shell gloves in the thigh pocket was to tight and unconformable. 

They ride low in the back.  Especially when you bend forward. 

I tested these in the mountains and they did not pass.  I am getting ride of them. 

Recommendations
1.  Use a button of more durable fastener.
2. Add belt loops to back up the integrated waist tie. 
3. Add about 3 cm to the back up the pant.
4. Add more material across the hips and thighs to accommodate athletics built people.
review.name: Design flaw

name: Chockstone Alpine Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: just received the helmet. the strap configuration was such garbage that i couldn't imagine a more unsafe scenario for a helmet.  i emailed Backcountry, and they refused to work with me on the unsafe helmet. ultimately the straps were placed in the wrong spot, resulting in, if you got hit, the helmet had zero security and would rip straight back. exposing the forehead and putting a ton of pressure on the neck. they refused a refund. be very cautious with this product.  the temple strap on the helmet was almost 2 inches Infront of the temple pad. in the pic i attached, imagine that strap closer to your eye brow and not anywhere near your temple. and now backcountry is refusing to help out in any way. i spent my money, just to have them tell me they might give me a refund if they think its a warranty issue. this is my safety, not a monetary issue, back country is at fault and i am disgusted at their response. it is like they do not value a consumers safety, just their profits.
review.name: unprofessional customer service. gross
comment: I'm sorry about the defective product that made it out your way. I have sent an email to help resolve this issue, thank you.

review.reviewBody: I had this jacket bookmarked for over 6 months before I finally bought it. Very happy with it, fit is roomy and quality is great. I bought the slate blue colour which looks more navy in the photos but is a bit lighter and true slate blue in person. Windproof, waterproof, comfortable, longer in the back fit like other Mountain Hardwear jackets i've purchased. Love it.
review.name: Great fit, Favourite jacket i own!

review.reviewBody:
I love this jacket. And I don’t write usually care to write these. I purchased this for a versatile, durable, waterproof shell that I can get dirty while working outside and then wash off and wear to the office in shoulder season weather (or winter with enough under it). It was meant to be a replacement to my last bad$&@ shell from Mountain Hardwear, the Sharkstooth something or other, and so far it is doing just that!

My only hope is that Mountain Hardwear will be able to move away from Goretex soon so we can all stay dry without worrying about the environmental impact of it.
review.name: I love it.

review.reviewBody: Disclaimer: I haven’t used this in the rain yet. Just wanted to give initial impressions, sizing, etc. High quality piece of gear. Seams, stitching, zippers, pulls are all good quality. I like the hood being separate from the collar, despite the additional fabric adding weight. I am 5’9” and about 165 lbs and wear a small.
review.name: Quality Gore-Tex Jacket

review.reviewBody: If your feet are narrow and low volume, these shoes will serve you better than any other.  My feet are super narrow but about 11.5/12 length, but also quite flat and low volume.  You know, like flippers.  Tenayas in general fit my foot type better than any other brand.  I spent 3 years trying different brands and models and could never find something that was both technical and comfortable.  Once I tried on Tenayas about 8 years ago, I haven?t looked back.  I didn?t think they could get better until they put this model out.  I?m on my third pair and cycle in between the Mundaka and Iati.  They are soft and sensitive- especially if you have larger feet, but I feel more secure heel hooking in these than any other shoe by far.  Edging is a bit harder, but you can feel more- so it?s a trade off.  It?s worth it for the comfort and overall technical prowess of this shoe.  If you have flippers, you should snag a pair.  I?m just slightly smaller than a 12 in street shoes, and I wear a 10.5 in Oasi LV.  They typically have a 2 session break in period where they?re a bit snug at first then hug my feet perfectly when broken in.  You?ll thank me for this review my freakish, flipper-footed friends!
review.name: Technical shoe for flippers!

review.reviewBody:
On this site I found out that these shoes are in men's sizing. Additionally, they run large. I'm a women so I downsize 2 sizes to get the shoe I actually need. So for me, my street shoe is 5.5 womens, so I buy a 3.5mens for a snug fit. (3.5mens =4.5 womens). 

I accidentally bought a 4.5 mens which = a 5.5 womens, thinking it was a women's 4.5 and had to return them because they are too big, even with socks. (there is a gap in the heel). 

I wish they would put the mens and womens sizing equivalents next to each other for maximum clarity on what you are getting. (amazon does this) Or add the EU or UK sizing.

Oasi's are awesome and are great once you get the sizing right. 

Sidenote: You would think that "A new version of the Oasi specifically adapted to the anatomy of the female foot." (Tenaya website)  would be in womens sizing, but the patriarchy wins again. Haha.
review.name: Beware, Mens Sizing
comment: Oof! I wish I read your review sooner Elizabeth, I'm actually going through this same situation right now. Luckily Backcountry has wonderful customer service and they were able to help me through this.
Thanks so much for this, I was under the same impression. They should really list the EU sizing.

name: Oasi LV Climbing Shoe

description: Buy the Black Diamond Oz Runner Set online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Oz Runner Set
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Oz Runner Set online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: buying the alpine draw is more affordable than buying the two carabiners separately. Overall I'm happy with these alpine draws as they are kind of the go-to for trad climbing
review.name: better deal

review.reviewBody: Was looking for a way to extend without using super bulky nylon runners. A buddy had these and recommended them. Love the hooded gate preventing snags and love how light they are. Barely takes up any room on my gear loop and does exactly what I need it to. Super pleased with them.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: My favorite combo of light and strong without taking up too much room on my rack.
review.name: Alpine draws

review.reviewBody: Augmented my positron draws with these keyhole hot wires. Can’t wait to clip some ice gear!
review.name: Light and smooth

review.reviewBody: They're not the cheapest but they're the best. Big enough for a gloved finger, if you're climbing alpine.
review.name: The best

review.reviewBody:
The size, feel, weight and versatility of these are unrivaled - really wish theses were not discontinued! Get them if you can find them, you will not regret it.

So good on ice, alpine and trad climbs.
review.name: Comeback when?

review.reviewBody:
The draws functionality is great - lightweight, don't snag, easy to use.

My only real issue is that the two grey carabiners are very difficult to differentiate. After extensive use, one carabiner will create sharp, jagged edges from repeated use on bolts, while the other side will be worn down (smooth) from the rope. It is important to distinguish these two sizes so as to prevent snagging and tearing the rope's sheath. This can easily occur if not careful.

I would like it if BD would anodize one significantly darker in order to differentiate the two sides.
review.name: Difficult to differentiate carabiners

review.reviewBody: I have ten of these on my rack.   they allow you freedom to wander.
review.name: must have in rack

review.reviewBody: I am a beginner when it comes to leading and the versatility these draws give was certainly a confidence booster.
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody:
A “QuickDraw” by definition is a runner that is quick to clip because the rope clipping carabiner is secured in a fixed position. So the very name of this product is totally misleading and contributes to overall misunderstanding of climbing terms. Please change the name of this product.

The “snag free” shroud has already become snagged in small bolt hangers and pitons repeatedly. I actually had to pound the carabiner out of a bolt hanger with a hammer to get it out. The shroud is just too big.
review.name: Miguided
comment:
Thank you for your review. Sorry to hear you found the product to be misleading. We sell these Alpine Quickdraws so that folks don't need to pick up the carabiners and runners separately. Securing the rope end would make it so the sling would need to be one length, making it less versatile for alpine needs.
As for the issues with clipping small bolt hangers and pitons, I have experienced this with older hardware at Smith Rock. In my experience, they are generally scenarios in which only one or two pieces have a small eyelet. Not a bad idea to carry smaller carabiners in the event that you're going to be clipping older hardware. Given that these are the smallest ones we make, you may need to look into a different manufacturer. In any case your feedback is appreciated!

name: Oz Runner Set
