review.reviewBody: Bought this so I could use as carry on with daypack separated. No issues to Europe or Asia also used as an outdoor climbing bag for gear. Great bag as straps hide. My only suggestion would be for a waist strap for daypack but I just bought one and added clips.
review.name: From Spain to Skokie’s to Nepal to Skaha bluffs

review.reviewBody:
nothing is perfect but so far I can't complain about the 60L backpack. Gave it a test run while hiking and its comfortable and pretty handy.
Would recommend it hands on
review.name: Great value

review.reviewBody: Have yet to put this item to use, but plan on taking it on our upcoming trip to Iceland next month. I have already packed most of what I will be needing. Between my carryon suitcase and this back pack, I have more than enough packing space! My favorite feature is the day bag that attaches to the front of the main back pack. This will be perfect for day hikes to store water and lunches in without having to carry the full backpack and add the extra unnecessary weight. Material seems to be durable and water resistant, which is exactly what I need for the type of traveling I will be doing.
review.name: First Impression

review.reviewBody:
Every centimeter of the Thule Landmark backpack is designed and crafted with intelligent thoroughness. All the people who brought this product idea to fruition deserves an instant bonus and/or promotion. There is no backpack I’ve owned that is as exceptional as this product. 

The first brilliant innovation, the dual-pack system which can attach to both back and front, is not only aesthetically awesome, but also very useful for times I don’t need to carry many things with me. I love every aspect of the design. It is obvious upon the first few moments of examining the bag that a lot of effort went into this product, and the quality speaks for itself. The zipper locks, the hardtop case for electronics and sunglasses, the backpack strap pockets which buckles tuck into, the quality of materials, and the way in which everything seamlessly fits together is amazing to me. I’ve owned Osprey and Eagle Creek bags (which are not companies to scoff at), but Thule really outdid themselves with this product design. I am very satisfied with my purchase, and look forward to everything else they have in store for the future. Please keep up the phenomenal work!! Merry Christmas and may God bless your team.
review.name: Superior Design and Quality

review.reviewBody:
I researched bags for our upcoming Europe trip for quite some time and Thule was always my top pick. I bought 5 of these bags for a bucket list trip to Europe for my family.  When I received my order, one of the zippers on the small pack was broke. I sent a warranty request in. They ended up sending me a complete set, the 40L and the 20L. AWESOME!! So happy with my purchase and can't wait to use them in the UK and France over Xmas 2022. Thank you so much 
again Thule!!
review.name: Awesome Warranty!!

review.reviewBody: Perfect size and very accommodating for traveling abroad.  With all the pockets and zipper tie downs, all the strap stow aways. I was able to feel comfortable and safe traveling with money passports and visas through Vietnam and South Korea
review.name: Great for travel.

review.reviewBody:
I traveled for 3 months with this backpack.

Good parts:

- It has a nice muted style without too many straps hanging around, if that's important to you (it was to me).

- It's roomy. I was able to pack for hot & cold weather, for hiking and going out in cities.

- Never a problem bringing the 40L on a flight as a carry-on, even when a gate agent would ask to inspect it beforehand.

Shortcomings I found:

- The "CashStash" compartment inside the 40L is where you're supposed to fit things like your passport and your emergency money. It's impossible to get to and slide your hand into once your bag is packed. I ended up using the "CashStash" of the 20L exclusively, as it is accessible from the outside of the bag (this only works if your 20L isn't packed inside your 40L).

- When laid horizontally on the ground, the part of the 40L that touches the floor is the same one that you wear on your back. Unlike the Osprey Farpoint, there is no cover you can zip up over the shoulder straps when not in use/as a floor protection. Now imagine wanting to change clothes in an airport bathroom stall when the floor tiles are a little bit wet...

- A feature is the ability to tuck away the shoulder straps & hip belts when not in use. This is too challenging to do when the bag is packed, as you're trying to jam the straps between two compressed layers of bag material. It's also difficult to fold/tuck the left & right sides in the same manner, leading to uneven "bumps" in the bag surface (uncomfortable when worn). I ended up keeping the straps loose for 3 months as a result.

- The main bag has an externally-accessible side pocket that Thule claims can hold a water bottle. The problem is that the pocket digs into the bag's contents, and if the bag is anywhere near full, the pocket can't "dig" and you can't use it.

- The chest straps can't be attached securely to the shoulder straps (a very baffling design choice). Reviews had mentioned this- I naively thought I would simply pay extra attention to not losing them. Yet I did... on my second day traveling. As the backpack combo comes with 2 pairs (one for each backpack), I ended up stuffing away the remaining pair and only took it out when necessary (annoying).

- The 20L lacks ways to organize your stuff inside of it. There's a laptop pouch, and that's it. Anything you put in there like clothes, cables, battery bank, etc. will get jumbled up.

- The 20L backpanel isn't breathable at all. Expect to be soaked everywhere the bag makes contact with your body from the lightest 10-min walk.

- The "SafeZone" compartment where you're supposed to stash your sunglasses and other fragile items isn't all that strong. I don't know exactly how it broke, but through the course of being handled by myself and bus operators, the top part became soft/not protective anymore. It feels like what happens when you fold a piece of cardboard and then try to straighten it out.

- This isn't an advertised feature of the combo, but in case you are wondering like I was prior to purchasing, they are absolutely not waterproof. I quickly learned having to line backpack contents in plastic bags.

- Last but not least, the material or construction quality doesn't seem high. See pictures taken on my 5th week traveling.
review.name: 3 months in South America revealed shortcomings

review.reviewBody: I just got this backpack and I think it's the best travel backpack I have ever owned. It is ergonomic and best of all, it has so many compartments literally for anything. I personally like the safety features and the fact that it has an extra backpack. I leave the big one at the hostel and carry the small one when I go sightseeing. I was expecting a darker green color but it still looks good though. Best backpack on a backpack.
review.name: Double Trouble

review.reviewBody: Traveling I use it which allows no luggage charges
review.name: The greatest backpack

review.reviewBody: A really great bag for travel, keeps things very organized with all of the different compartments. I really like the feature around the bag being able to be used for day trips, versatility is key. Would highly recommend.
review.name: Awesome bag!

review.reviewBody:
I use it daily. The down part really works , no warm up time when your head hit the pillow. 
 Keep up the good work.
review.name: I use it daily. The

review.reviewBody: This thermarest air head down pillow is a MUST! So much comfort! I used to not carry a pillow and simply used cloths piled up as a pillow. But now....after experiencing this pillow....I will never backpack without it. Way too small and lightweight to worry about the additional few ounces....
review.name: GOTTA have this down pillow for backpacking!

review.reviewBody:
Love this little luxury sleeping product to make nights in the backcountry a little bit more comfortable. Packs super small and easy to blow up. The added layer of down is a nice touch to add warmth rather then just an air filled pillow.
I like that I can adjust the firmness with letting a little air out.
review.name: Packs small and comfortable

review.reviewBody: Happy with this pillow. I bought it hoping it would be more comfortable than others I have used. Only used for one hunt and did not find it any better than lighter weight options. If counting ounces go with lighter weight and more compact options for no disadvantages I see. If weight isn’t as crucial I think it’s more personal preference.
review.name: Heavier than most, not as compact but still comfortable.

review.reviewBody: Excellent compact pillow! Very Comfortable and lightweight. Down covering does an excellent job of making the pillow feel more like a standard pillow. I did have to play with the amount of inflation to get optimum comfort. I highly recommend this pillow.
review.name: Excellent compact pillow! Very Comfortable

review.reviewBody: Better than my pillow at home. Packs down small (enough) and totally worth it for good nights of sleep on the trail.
review.name: Best backpacking sleep pillow I’ve ever used

review.reviewBody: Nice pillow, light and inflates easy. Not sure the down makes a whole lot of difference. Pretty thin too, would recommend for back sleepers, definitely not for side sleepers.
review.name: Nice pillow, light and inflates

review.reviewBody: I bought this pillow for a 10-night river rafting trip. The pillow was comfy, comfy warm and easy to dry. Personally, I am a picky pillow sleep in my normal life and had no problem adjusting to this pillow. Size and weight are both great. (Small and light). would recommend to anyone looking for a pillow.
review.name: I bought this pillow for

review.reviewBody: Nice size. A little sticky on the skin. No crinkly noise.
review.name: Nice size. A little sticky

review.reviewBody: We initially bought this to use for preschool and carrying a folder and lunchbox - it is too small for that. That being said-we love this backpack. It’s perfect for our tall 3 year old to wear out and about. It fits his potty seat, a spare set of clothes, a few toys and snacks.

Usually when we travel, he gets uncomfortable and “so tired” of wearing his backpack that we end up carrying it. This was the first time ever that didn’t happen and he carried his own pack! It is in perfect condition after traveling across Italy for two weeks and it was so cute on him - definitely recommend and I’m glad we added it for this trip (and hopefully many more in the future!).

description: Buy the Eureka! Kohana 6 Tent: 6-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Kohana 6 Tent: 6-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the Eureka! Kohana 6 Tent: 6-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Easy set up. Love that we can stand in the middle.
review.name: Excellent choice

review.reviewBody: Lots of room for our family of 4 and easy setup even with 1 person. The double vestibule is handy to have with kids. The first time weekend used this test we got rained on for 7 hours straight. We stayed dry the whole time and this tent's ventilation kept things from getting too stuffed up inside at night. Highly recommend for anyone in need of a new campground tent!
review.name: excellent car camping tent

review.reviewBody: Excellent product design and portability. Great to have a lightweight family tent.

I used the Kohana 6 for two weeks of camping in Dinosaur National Monument two summers ago.  I experienced a couple days and nights of thunderstorms with high winds and pounding rain.  The tent was fully staked and guyed out with the fly properly attached including all Velcro pole attachment loops on the underside.    No leaks whatsoever.  The fly did a great job..  The only negative was  that the poles slightly deformed due to days of hammering winds.  Still very usable, but the tent is now slightly asymmetrical when set up.  I've experienced this with other large two-pole aluminum poled "x" dome tents under similar circumstances in the past, so it's probably a weakness of the simple pole structure design when mated to a large tent with big winded surfaces.  That said, there's a lot to like about the simplicity of setting up and taking down a two-pole tent that would be lost by the addition of additional poles for greater rigidity.
review.name: Kohana 6 - big, simple and adequate basecamp tent

review.reviewBody: I've had this tent for a while and really like the features, the space and the ease of setup. But I finally used it in the rain last weekend and it was a disaster. It started raining a little before midnight and rained off and on until 2pm the next day. It wasn't torrential but steady with short breaks. By the morning, the tent was leaking in multiple spots, all of them where something was sewn to the fly, like the toggle for the vestibule door or the velcro straps to hold fly on. This is clearly a design flaw.  I m really disappointed because it means I can't use this tent in the rain and where I live and camp, rain is always a possibility.
review.name: Not waterproof
comment: Thank you for your review of the Kohana 6. We would be happy to assist you with a warranty replacement rainfly for your early Kohana 6. The vestibule seam issue has been corrected. You may call our Customer Service at 1-800-572-8822 M-F between 8am and 4:30pm EST.

review.reviewBody: On February 14, 2022 I received my Eureka Kahona 6 Campaign Tents. On February 18, 2022 I first use the Tents. In its aerodynamic form it is excellent. Withstand the winds. In all aspects it is excellent. The only thing I regret about the tents is that it doesn't have a compartment for E-port and the others is that the guide lines are not reflective, as I have in other tents that I have that came with tents
review.name: Great Tents

review.reviewBody:
After doing much research online for a new 6 person tent, I decided on the Kohana 6. My decision for this tent was: 
1) Wanted a tent with a full fly. Tired of tents with the fly not going down all the way on the sides of the tent and water leaking in.  Kohana has a full fly.
2) With the full fly, I still wanted ventilation on a hot night when it is raining and I have the fly closed.  The Kohana has great ventilation with it's two vestibules and it's two fly vents.  Can breath in the tent even in a down pour.
3) Easy to set up.  Very easy for one person to set up. I watched the video and did a practice run in my yard before my camping trip.  Once I went camping, I had it set up in 20 minutes by myself and that was taking my time.

So I went camping with it the third week of July 2021.  After I got it set up, the rain was brutal.  Continued for 24 hours.  The inside of my Kohana was totally dry.  Very impressive.  And I was still able to breath in it due to the great ventilation.
About 2 am, I heard a large noise and my tent collapsed on me.  My first thought was "I can't believe that my new tent collapsed from the weight of the rain".  Wrong.  A massive tree limb broke right above the tent and fell on it. And me. The tent held and the limb touched me at first but the tent "pushed" it back a foot off of me so I was able to push it off from the inside.  Basically the tent kept me from getting crushed.  I checked the next morning, and it was a BIG tree limb.  No tears in the tent but one of the poles was slightly bent.  The pole did it's job.  It bent but didn't break so I did not get hurt.

I called Eureka when I got  home and told them what happened and asked if I could buy a new pole.  Customer Service paid for me to ship the whole tent back and they sent me a brand new Kohana 6 for the cost of a new pole.  A tree falling on the tent is obviously not covered under warranty so this was Eureka Customer Service going above and beyond. Obviously, I recommend both the Kohana 6 and Eureka Customer Service to my fullest with all sincerity.... 
Thanks...H.
review.name: Perfect Tent!

review.reviewBody:
I normally don't write reviews but after a 6 day camping trip, must say, this tent deserves some love. For the money, it's really fabulous. Some excellent features: 
1. Well-placed interior pockets that are edge banded (not purely mesh like on my Big Agnes tent).
2. 2 large doors with D zipper pattern.
3. Great vestibule. Symmetric design with front & back vestibules. Large vestibules areas when fully zipped - could hold a ton of gear under the rain fly. Nice open entryway with extension poles. (see photos with custom poles from broom handles.)
4. Exterior pocket on both front and back!  At first I thought an exterior pocket was weird. I was wrong. It's extremely handy as a staging area to collect items you want inside the tent at a later time, but perhaps you don't want to let bugs in or wear down the zipper for each item.
5. Color. The orange - mint - dark turqoise combo is gorgeous. 
6. The carrying bag is unique. It has separate zipped compartments for the main tent and rain fly and smaller interior compartments for the stakes + guylines. I would have preferred two handles for carrying, rather than the single strap, but it's a cool idea overall.
review.name: All Around Superb Tent

review.reviewBody: I found this tent to be superior to competitors in it's design characteristics for a tent this size.  Great airflow, thicker material, light weight for the size, easy to set up, good sized vestibules, good gear pockets, and nice room for 5.
review.name: Well-designed tent.

review.reviewBody: I was a little disappointed with how sharply the sides slant in which really cuts down on the standing and living space. Two people can just live comfortably. The top center height is actually less than 72 inches and that is right in the center. there is about a 36 by 36 head area for standing and it is less than 72 inches. I have been use to camping in the past with people in the past with larger and higher conditions. I bought this tent for mainly now camping alone, since my camping people have passed. So I was not aware of the dimensional conditions of this style. nevertheless, it is easy to put up and the design of the fly should keep me dry. I love that I can put up the front and back vestibule flaps on poles. There are plenty of pockets inside for storage. Over all it is a superb tent worth the price.
review.name: well constructed for a light tent

name: Kohana 6 Tent: 6-Person 3-Season

review.reviewBody: I have other droppers to compare to and it is a great post. Bought this for my XC rocket due to light weight and on sale for a killer price so wouldn't be too hurt if it was junk.  Paired with a Wolftooth trigger and it works great.  It is smooth and has zero play (other 4 droppers have slight play).  People complain it isn't 'as fast as other droppers' but it hasn't been noticeable riding. At the sales price this is a steal for XC weight watchers programs. Fit the bill for me.
review.name: Smooth and Tight

review.reviewBody: I broke the little cable retainer on a KS post that came on my new intense trail bike. I don’t even understand when to use a dropper post so it’s of little use to me but I didn’t want the groms laughing at me having a rigid post. Anyway, this post is light with no play so I am very satisfied with that. It does seem to extend slowly but I’m ok with that since I don’t really use it.
review.name: Awesome at the sale price

review.reviewBody: Well made good quality and easy install.

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of Cloudmonster shoes and I love them.  I like the thick soles, which absorb shock on my long walks and gym workouts.
review.name: Comfortable & Supportive

review.reviewBody: I wish these would've worked out, but the sizing was wildly off. I wear a W's 8 1/2 in other On Running shoes and my feet were swimming in these. Ultimately I returned these.
review.name: Sizing Off - Way Too Big

review.reviewBody: Incredibly comfortable shoes that comes in alot of different cool and cute designs. After a full day of walking around a theme park, feet were not sore which is a HUGE PLUS! The fact that these shoes are also super lightweight is also something that is greatly appreciated. Highly recommend!
review.name: Comfortable and Supportive Shoes

review.reviewBody:
These are great, and super lightweight and comfortable out of the box! They even performed great on the trail. Also that white and orange color scheme looks absolutely fire, and I love the polka dotted shoelaces!
I'm not usually into maximally cushioned shoes, but I honestly really liked these. They are super light, but have tons of support too as another Gearhead mentioned - a nice stiff sole with a cushy footbed. They were even supportive enough for my feet and ankles to hit the trail. Not rock plate needed with that thick cushioned, protective sole! On Cloud has extensive tech in their air light sole - they are known as a top designer in this space for a reason and where they get the name from! The cubed sole you'll see on nearly all of their shoes is made of a special firm EVA (On Cloud calls it the Zero Gravity foam) with an open air pocket in the middle of the midsole and hollowed out cubes that are cut down the line of the shoe, which adds flexibility than most typical shoe soles.

For my couple hour run, I encountered some snow and mud and rocks. My feet never got too hot. These Monsters ventilate and breathe super well, which is important for me. They are also very responsive, so I was able to be precise on the trail. Also great for just strolling around the neighborhood. Did I mention how fire they look? I mean, just check out the pics! Also run true to size for my size 10 foot.
review.name: Awesome Sneakers with a lot of Tech!

review.reviewBody: I have loved the Cloudmonsters ever since they came out. I got a chance to try these new Cloudmonster 2s early and love them even more than the original! On the original, I was right in between sizes and ended up wearing a 9.5 instead of my regular 9, but in this model, the 9 fits me perfect! I'm not sure if the length was changed or if there's just more fabric in the top toe area, but either way, I'm a pretty true 9 in running shoes and the 9 in these is perfect. If On shoes are typically too narrow for you, these are the exception with a wider toe box that will fit a much broader range of people. Other than the fit being better for me, I also appreciate the improved lacing system. The footbed in these is absolutely perfect. They are so plush and comfortable, but not TOO soft. I've tried other running shoes that are plush but have too much cushion and feel like marshmallows and end up hurting my calves, but these are the perfect balance of being comfortable yet supportive. I couldn't dial them in any better if I tried. I rate these at a 10/10 as they check every box for me. If you have any questions about these or any On products, feel free to reach out to me at amcclary@backcountry.com or 801-204-4562.
review.name: Plush yet Supportive

review.itemreviewed: Minion DHR II Wide Trail Dual Compound EXO/TR 29in Tire
review.reviewBody:
It always should be said to choose the proper tool for the job.  With respect to traction in turns and on the damp, these tires are legit.  I doubled up and ran DHR II both in the front and rear.  Still getting a feel for it but so far I think it is just as good as a DHF/DHR combo.  I push about 25psi/26psi front to rear (195lbs).

I am notorious for being rough on tires and tend to slice side walls in the chunky stuff here in CO.  I switched to Bontrager SE4 and they stood up well.

So why come back to Maxxis and if you are rough on tires why go with a tan sidewall which is less durable...
Because it will lighten things up weight wise,, but really because it looks dope as hell.

I'm working on line choice this summer and sparing my bikes trauma.  I'll look good while doing it.
review.name: Be Selective

name: Minion DHR II Wide Trail Dual Compound EXO/TR 29in Tire

review.itemreviewed: Dynama High Rise Lined Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: These pants are so comfortable and flattering. I have the unlined version in many colours and was excited to find a warmer version.  Definitely recommend.
review.name: So happy they made a warmer version of my favourite pants!

review.itemreviewed: Dynama High Rise Lined Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love these pants, but I have a couple of concerns to mention. First, the waist has become significantly larger after wearing them, and I wish they had drawstrings or some way to tighten it. While I have hips to keep them up, they might slip down for other women with slimmer figures. Additionally, they tend to pill a lot, especially in areas where the seatbelt rubs or around the backside where they come into contact with my backpack. A fabric shaving is helpful but I have not figured out how to tighten the waist yet
review.name: Be aware of some major issues

name: Dynama High Rise Lined Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: When I transitioned into kayak fishing, I just thought I would be able to use the pants from my foul weather gear set up.  What I soon realized is that they are designed for standing and not for sitting.  After 3 hours on the water I needed to quit (and I was on the bite too!) because the pants were SO tight in my crotch.  Before buying the Endurance Pants, I made sure I spent some time seated in a kayak at the shop.  Much more comfortable and it gives me pleasure to see claims of ?designed for paddlers? really is true.  These are worth the investment.
review.name: More comfortable seated

review.reviewBody:
This pack is perfect for the thru-hiker, UL weekender, or peak bagger. 

Given, the prospector weighs a bit more than some HyperLite/Ultimate Direction etc. Ultra Light(UL)  packs. BUT this pack makes it worth it with the difference in comfort and support. I find the stiff back panel and multiple cinch points at the shoulders, hips, and along the back panel really help you distribute the load perfectly… which makes it seem like you are carrying less weight! After maybe a dozen big outings with this pack, I have found it might be the best weight distributing pack I have owned - even for loads up to 50 lbs. 

This pack is a quiver-killer, it is like the child of an UL pack and a modern backpacking bag, taking the best features from both. Highly recommend.
review.name: Good cross between UL and comfort

review.reviewBody: Comfortable. A lot of pockets. Very convenient to handle!
review.name: Great product!

review.reviewBody: I’ve been using my Scarpa Goldengate 2 several weeks for my daily trail walk/hike and I love them! My route is up and down hills over exposed tree roots and rocks as well as gravel and dirt. These shoes handle all surfaces equally well. The fit in the heel is solid and stable and the toe box is roomy and wide enough for my forefoot to move naturally. This is my first pair of Scarpa shoes, I am impressed with how well they are working for me. I chose the size based on their recommendation, I normally wear women’s 9.5 and bought the 41.5. The 41 probably would have been fine as well but I am happy with the 41.5.
review.name: Solid and stable support

review.reviewBody: Fits well and is comfortable! Lots of functional loops. Very lightweight
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody: The size of the harness matches the specifications. It is comfortable and light, and its materials seem resistant to theuse on rock climbing or ice climbing.
review.name: Light and comfotable

review.reviewBody: Bought this for my sister and it fit very nicely. Adjusted to fit legs and was comfortable. When hanging, it supported legs well too.
review.name: Excellent Harness! Comfortable too

review.reviewBody: I bought this in an XS a couple of years ago but just sized up to the S. It's a solid entry-level harness at a great price point. My only complaint is that the waist strap needs to be several inches longer -- the reason I sized up is that it was a struggle to get on without completely unbuckling. I don't have particularly wide hips, and the S is almost too big in the waist, but that's the tradeoff.
review.name: Solid budget harness

review.reviewBody:
At this price, who wouldn't want this harness. I like the padding. 
-sturdy gears loops
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody: After years away from climbing, I’m finally getting back into it. This harness fits like a glove and is perfect for the indoor gym. We will see how well it hold up once it’s time to hit the big walls this summer
review.name: Great harness

review.reviewBody: The harness itself is fine, comfortable, etc. but like everyone I know who bought this harness were hoping it was pinker than it turned out to be. Literally more than half the women in the gym. Please come out with a pinker version, like the rope and draws that you make.
review.name: Not pink enough

review.reviewBody: 0rdered a S, M, and a L , all of them fit a bit Smaller than anticipated. Other than that everything works great.
review.name: Fits a bit smaller

review.reviewBody: This is the first "real" harness I have used, besides the one-size-fits-most rentals & the harnesses you find at summer camps. It feels like a great quality and is very comfortable to wear. The quick adjust on the leg loops is super easy and nice. My only complaint is that I felt like the padding, while providing comfort, also didn't breathe as well and therefore found myself getting warmer and sweatier than I have previously experienced in other harnesses. Otherwise I think this is great and I'm pumped to have my first harness! (couldn't beat the price on this in the outlet either)
review.name: Comfortable but Warm

review.reviewBody: Got these at the recommendation of my climber friend as a good harness for a beginner climber that balances cost and quality, and I am not disappointed!
review.name: Got these at the recommendation

name: Momentum Harness - Women's

review.reviewBody: Good coat but the zipper always gets hung up at the top unless you have the hood on to keep the zipper lined up.  Pretty annoying.
review.name: Zipper gets stuck a lot

review.reviewBody:
Nice Jacket. The waterproof membrane treatment is a big improvement, no more mesh covering the raw membrane. The finish inside and out feels high quality.

There is elastic to tighten the hood around your skull, but there is no longer a way to cinch the hood opening. I like to be able to fully seal out the cold and wind and would use this feature especially when not wearing the hood to seal the neck.

The waist elastic is only able to tighten via an adjustment slider in the right pocket. If you like it cinched tight like I do, the cord will be very long in your pocket.
review.name: Nice Jacket but...

review.reviewBody: Almost Perfect. Good quality, fit, and style in a lightweight rain jacket. Its only shortcoming is lack of a two way zipper which would be extremely useful in a jacket of this type.
review.name: Almost Perfect

review.reviewBody: Not suitable for southeastern rain showers. The jacket keeps me decently dry, but water puddles in the pockets. After a moderate shower, there was probably 1/4 cup of water in each pocket, which I don’t know can be attributed to condensation and makes the pockets useless for storage. It also does not breathe well in the humidity of NC.
review.name: Decent water protection with flaws

review.reviewBody: I am 5’9” at 175lbs with an average build. The medium is not too loose and feels great!! The sleeves are tad long but not bad at all. I had the zipper catch a couple times over a past couple days, but that’s me rushing. The cut works very well with my height. The only thing that bothers me is the jacket pitches a tent by the stitching in the midsection of the jacket when you sit down.
review.name: Great cut for guys around 5’9”

name: Threshold Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: We got this for our son who just turned two. It’s the perfect size for him. He’s a little tall for his age. The chest clip is great so it doesn’t fall off his shoulders. We recently took a flight and he kept two stuffies and couple other small toys (lightweight) in the backpack and he did great wearing it the whole time. Would highly recommend to someone looking for a backpack for a small child.
review.name: Perfect Toddler Backpack

review.reviewBody: I bought this for my 2 year old granddaughter and it fits her perfect.  She has enough room for  her water, beloved Lovey, snacks or lunch and a few odds and ends she grabs as she leaves to go hiking.  She loves her "packpack" so much, little sis is getting one and we will save it for her for when she knows how to walk.
review.name: Perfect backpack

hasVariant.description: Buy the Mystery Ranch Rip Ruck 15L Daypack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Bag has every feature needed for a quick day bag or school/work bag. Laptop sleeve is perfect, water bottle holders, easy access zipper storage inside for organizing and the quick open lid is probably the best feature. Went back and forth between sizes but the 15l ended up being perfect for my use
review.name: Quick and easy day bag

review.reviewBody: I bought this to have a small backpack for my computer, accessories etc. for when I fly. The quality is amazing. The price is so much lower than other comparable packs. It really is a killer deal. I don't see any issues with this pack. Just know that it's small.
review.name: Amazing pack. Amazing quality

review.reviewBody:
As expected, the bag is thoughtfully designed and feels like it will last forever. I got it for a small everyday carry or daypack. Longtime Dana fan and still satisfied. The "rip" opening is convenient and a great design. I'd say closing it is a little cumbersome, you have to do it in two separate pulls for each side - you can see the guy in the video fumble a little, too - but the easy access is nice. I thought I would want a real, full closure instead of just the magnets, but so far so good.

Burly - almost over-reinforced, which doesn't seem necessary for such a little pack, but will likely last forever and I always appreciate over-engineering for longevity.

Perfect size - fits more than expected. My 16" laptop and a tablet in the sleeves plus a days worth of layers or extra clothes, binos, camera, whatever. Great little daypack.
review.name: Incredible bag - great size and design

review.reviewBody: I really like the bag. The best feature is obviously the “rip” of the main compartment and how fast you can get access the problem is that closing the lid takes a lot more time and precision than normal backpacks as the lid has to be lined up well. I think perhaps a different, stiffer material than Robic around the zipper area would have been better. There’s also only the outside slip pocket and one mesh pocket inside. That’s it for organization. I wish there was a few more organizational features. Overall, I really like the bag and think it looks cool, but would have liked to see those improvements.
review.name: Very good bag with a few quirks

review.reviewBody: Glad that I bought the 15L second gen model just before the third gen came out, which looks too space age-y for me. Love the streamlined look of second gen. Have no issues with only one bottle sleeve. Would've liked wider inside sleeves for small books or pouches. My main complaint is that the Robic fabric is not robust enough. Dropped my bag sideways and my laptop (with blunt corners) ripped through the unpadded part of the back panel (highlighted in blue in picture). This happens more often than you'd think. I have done this with four bags including this one. The only one that didn't cause an open rip is another MR with Cordura fabric. So now I put my laptop in another sleeve not to protect the laptop, but to avoid another rip. Short of changing the fabric in future iteration, I'd suggest at least lining the inside of that panel, like the bottom of the bag. A bigger change would be to pad the whole of the back.
review.name: Nice military style, lousy fabric

review.reviewBody:
I apparently have the older version of this pack, but I do like it quite a bit anyway. Mine does not have the laser cut Mollie grid on the front instead it has one row of Daisy chain fabric zone to one side that you could clip a few things to I would say it has just the right amount of internal organization, the front pocket is fairly decent even though it is a sideways pocket thing stand there fairly well and it's a great quick access spot and there are two small pouches on the inside on the sides that are also very handy. The one place I got a little irritated. There was nothing was the top flap lid where you can feel that there's enough fabric between the two layers to put in a small pocket for sunglasses or something like that to seem like a wasted opportunity to put in a pocket that pretty much everyone would love.

But all that said you know you deal with the fact that it's not USA made but if you can get around that this is a great pack and oddly enough fits my 16 inch MacBook Pro
review.name: Review of Older Version...

review.reviewBody: I bought my pack for Disneyland trips and it has worked out wonderfully. I love that it holds everything I need for the day without being too big.
review.name: Great size

review.reviewBody: This Rip ruck series are my favourite bags. This one is great for a small pack for carrying around the essentials.
review.name: Amazing Small Bag

review.reviewBody: Only have had this for a month now. Love all the inside pockets as they are in the correct spots. The outside of the pack has no wear on it. It is the perfect size for out on the town or going to work as it fits in my locker. The only fabric is extremely tough but things like feathers or lint sticks to it. I will update this review if it catches. It holds heavy weights very well. Stanley Growler full of beer and all my other stuff and it didn’t feel like I had that much weight in it. My back was still happy so win win. I will be buying another in a new color. Just love the little thing.
review.name: Perfect Size

review.reviewBody: Bought this for a trip to NYC and it fit our tripod, small umbrellas, coats, water and miscellaneous small items.  Small enough to be maneuverable and a personal item for air travel but big enough to pack for a day trip.  Very durable and rugged build but still simple and minimal enough to be stylish, love the minimalist design and capability.  Double zipper main rip-zip panel access entry can be a bit cumbersome/finicky to open without using one side zip at a time, perhaps bigger zipper would help?  Love the magnets!  Would love to see this same minimalist design in the 24L.  Overall excellent mini pack!
review.name: Excellent day bag

name: Rip Ruck 15L Daypack

review.itemreviewed: Hatchet Snowboard x John Fellows - LE - 2025
review.reviewBody: Absolutely love this board. She’s my go to on resort. Handles groomers with speed, easy to ride switch, and even a 2’ powder day cannot sink this board. It just POPS out of the deep stuff. Killer graphic and you have the total package. I’m 6’1” 215lbs and the 156 crushes for me. Highly recommend you throw one of these in your kit, but beware, you may not ride anything else in your quiver the rest of the season!
review.name: Quiver killer! Believe it.

review.itemreviewed: Hatchet Snowboard x John Fellows - LE - 2025
review.reviewBody: I love this board! Super wide so you can ride it short and it still stays afloat on the deepest days! The directional twin shape makes it easy to ride and land switch whether on groomers or in deep snow. That being said, it is very wide and as such, not super quick edge-to-edge on hard snow. But you can treat this board on soft snow!
review.name: This thing FLOATS

name: Hatchet Snowboard x John Fellows - LE - 2025

review.reviewBody: Light and waterproof. Haven’t tested it extensively in heavy rain but biking around town it’s fantastic and packs down easily when I’m not wearing it.

I work outdoors, and this has been so nice to wear in the rain! I love that I don't have to worry about rain leaking in and getting wet, and now it makes me want to go play outside in the rain just to wear it.
review.name: Great quality

review.reviewBody:
I really love my Aspire II Jacket! I live in Portland, OR, so this jacket is my constant companion on most activities (walks, hikes, errands, etc.). So far it's keeping me very dry. I love the side zipper pockets for ventilation and the bright, ultramarine color.

One note, though: It does fit a bit tighter around the hips/waist than some other shirts and jackets I own, but overall, I like the fit.
review.name: Great Jacket

review.reviewBody: The item is certainly above par for a rain jacket but doesn’t hold up to the OR name. It simply doesn’t feel as good as other comparable OR products. The jacket ran considerably small for rain jacket, and the seems were not bound as much as one would have hoped. The material itself and zipper were all high quality. Not upset with this, but a little disappointed.
review.name: Not the usual OR quality

review.reviewBody:
Love this jacket. 
-Compact (folds up into pocket)
-Fits as expected (with room for some layering)
-Chest pocket is unusual and useful in lightweight foldup jacket
-Pit zip design is very versatile & easy to use
-Very waterproof 
-Looks good
review.name: Lightweight, Great Features

review.reviewBody:
Did not fit as described, tight for women’s sizes in the chest. Used for hiking trip in Grand Canyon, water repellent factor was excellent. Sizing needs to be more descriptive, color and zippers are excellent as well. 

Overall good purchase for someone with less sizing needs and will hold up to the elements. Price point is reasonable for quality and performance of the jacket. Would purchase again.
review.name: Rain coat

review.reviewBody: The jacket is super cute, but is slimmer than I anticipated. I sent it back saying that I wanted to exchange for the next size but only had the option to return it (for a fee). I would have preferred an exchange for no fee and was frustrated that this wasn't an option on the website. It did feel pretty waterproof to me, although the fabric also felt a bit stiff and loud, but I only tried it on at home before sending it back.
review.name: Wish there was a way to exchange for another size!

review.reviewBody: High-end detailing. The hood adjustments are great as are the full side zippers. Wore this jacket for days on a rainy hiking trip and it never disappointed.
review.name: Exceptional value and rain protection!

review.reviewBody: Here's the thing: I don't think any rain jacket is perfect. However, this kept me mostly dry during our 2 week trip to Vietnam during rainy season. Rain would come and go, so the jacket would be off and on, which made it difficult to keep the inside dry, but that's not the fault of the jacket. The hood was nice a secure and the pit zips were a lifesaver for the muggy heat that came with the rain. After being packed up damp several times it had a funky smell that was easily remedied by a bake in the sun. When I did wear it for an extended period of time, I noticed a little moisture coming inside the barrier but again, for the most part, stayed dry. Would buy again and am glad to have in my gear collection now.
review.name: Held up in rainy Vietnam

review.reviewBody: I love the large hood and longer torso length. A chest pocket is always a nice touch and the two way zippers along the side and under arms are great for temperature control. The waterproofing works perfectly, no leaks.
review.name: Perfect fit

name: Aspire II Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Couple quick overnighters logged so far and the pad has been inflated since time of purchase otherwise. It's the livability details such as the Air Stream inflation system having it's own compartment in the stuff sack, 2 stage inflation, deflation port and consistency of the baffles that makes a very thin pad sufficient for any sleeping position. The included repair kit is basically industry standard but it's better than almost all other brands included system. It's light, it packs small the only downside is the 1. 5 season use. On a 40F night it felt like my shoulder season sleeping bag was holding heat the same above and below me. I would not take this pad for any cold ground endeavors. It is a summer+ pass exactly as advertised and as several reviews state. Durability seems to have good reviews but I'll have to follow up.
review.name: Ultra light with S2S Quality

review.reviewBody: I’m not kind to my gear. This mat put up with a lot of mistreatment, but was able to hold its last breath almost 5 years after I’d originally purchased it. While it was an uncomfortable last couple of nights in the BWCA having to wake up every 2-3 hours to re-inflate, I’m absolutely impressed by this product.
review.name: A bittersweet ending

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Light, compact, and comfortable. Took it out for a late fall backpacking trip in the desert for its first adventure and slept great.
review.name: Great pad

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very light and comfy. I love the inflation system and dump valve. Packs small and very light!
review.name: Super comfy and light

review.reviewBody: With +30 miles of portaging and paddling, I wanted something light, and this did the trick. Same for Isle Royale, hiking 21 miles and I never worried about getting a decent night’s sleep. I’m 170 lbs and 5’11”, and the Regular mat works great. I’m most surprised by its durability.
review.name: From the BWCA to Isle Royale

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super compact and lightweight. This kept me comfortable on a multiple day backpacking/mountaineering trip.
review.name: Super compact and lightweight. This

review.reviewBody: Light weight, Has not failed after 2 years, could be a tiny bit wider for my frame but other than that. She's solid.
review.name: Solid for its price point

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this mat! I'm a 5'0" female backpacking guide and have to carry extra gear for the group. I was looking for a lightweight sleeping mat to go with my quilt in an effort to lighten my personal items. It's comfortable!
review.name: Ultralight Air sleeping mat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This mat is currently my primary bed. I am completely impressed with how comfortable it is for how small it packs down. Also I love the technology of the stuff sack that also blows up the mat.
review.name: This mat is currently my

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This sleeping pad is perfect for backpacking trips with the grandsons. I ordered two each size small for them which weigh in around 12 ozs. each.

review.reviewBody: Had to order an entire size up, but super comfortable, great stretch hiking pant. Love the roll cuffs. Everything is perfect about these pants minus the sizing.
review.name: Runs very small

review.reviewBody: These pants are amazing.  It's so sad they are discontinued (or at least not available anywhere!).  They are the right length for a petite, they have a nice amount of stretch and still look like a decent pair of pants for traveling or dinner.
review.name: Nice Trail Pants

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] They’re nice pants but they were too tight so I had to return them.
review.name: Fit smll

review.reviewBody: Workmanship, material, weight and feel of these pants is great for the price I paid ($40). Nice for everyday casual, travel, work or outdoor activities so very versatile. Fit could be an issue and I wish people had fully explained in all the many reviews I read before buying. The size guide is very misleading so I would say they run small and here's why. These are true to size with regard to waistband measurement HOWEVER, they sit a little lower in front and higher in back and they are very short-waisted pants so, for me, the waist buttons 1.5 - 2" below my waist which means the waistband is a little snug and I have a little back/hip squish that wants to bubble up over the waistband but, if I size up, the booty and legs will be a bit looser. If I wear them closer to my natural waist that reduces the waistband snugness but then there's a bit of a wedgie/camel toe situation that happens. Thankfully, it's not really noticeable to anyone but me and remarkably, they're still pretty comfortable because of the lightweight material and the little bit of give that it has so I'm keeping the pair I just bought. I may try a size up at some point to see if I like the fit and feel of that better. I would say these work best for people who are slim in waist and hips but have a decently wide and full booty and thighs to fill them out, lol. They are designed to fit more snugly so if you like a looser fit and have your heart set on this exact pant, definitely size up one or maybe even two sizes depending on how loose you want them. For reference, I'm 5'4", 140#, 37.5" hips, 18.5 - 19" inseam, athletic build, flat stomach but a lil' bit of squish in the back hip area and a full booty but not a wide booty. I typically wear a size 6 or 8 in pants and I bought an 8R in these. The 8R mostly fit pretty well and they do look nice but for a little more comfortable fit, I might also try a 10R at some point. I'm right on the edge height-wise and have neither a long torso or long legs, I'm split pretty evenly for my height but I did not and would not try the short version because I'm afraid they would be just a touch too short with certain shoes and I don't like the flood pant look for myself.
review.name: Nice Multipurpose Pants

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I’m 5’2” I wish they were 2 inches shorter in length but the fit is perfect and they are very comfortable for work.
review.name: Comfy work pants

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great pants. I don’t know if they’ve changed the sizing, but my old size 6 may have been stretched out, and meanwhile, I lost weight. I ordered the new ones in a six long, and they fit perfectly. A better rise to the waistband helps. They look stylish enough to wear out, not just for  Hiking. hopefully they don’t stretch at the waist.
review.name: Great fit

review.reviewBody: Bought these for a hiking and travel.  They fit well, and look nice.  Seems to run true to my size.  130 lbs, 5 ft tall.  size 10 short.
review.name: Travel Pants

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good quality, my height is 5"3' and I ordered short and it was perfect for me.
review.name: Worth of your money

review.reviewBody: These pants are great quality. Not super breathable, so I would wear in cooler temperatures.
review.name: Well made hiking pants

name: Saturday Trail Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: I love this tent... Two hiking poles 4 stakes and my dyneema tarp are unbeatable for weight, breathability, and size.. I don't even bring a ground sheet cause the floor is made of some space age material
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: The thru Hiker 3 is better suited for 2 people. The Thru-Hiker 1 provides approximately 33" width for 1 person, Thru-Hiker 2 provides approximately 26" width per person where as the Thru-Hiker 3 only provides approximately 21" width per person, adding only 14" to the width for an additional person. In my experience, 26-28" is the minimum width for me to be comfortable (depending on side wall slope), so the Thru-Hiker 3 is unrealistic for average adults, but may be doable for some. Quality is as you'd expect for a MSR product.
review.name: Too Small

review.reviewBody: I there was a 7 feet x 7feet verion of the Mesh House availible that would acomodate 3 large mats, i promise that i buy it. My 2 sons are to young to sleep alone but to big to sleep confotable i a 3 perons shelter. Thanks and friendly greeting Johan Yes i recomend MSR to my friends, i am verry happy wiht my waterfilter and waterbag, mat and conforter
review.name: I will buy a4 person Thrue hiker mesh house

review.reviewBody: Positives: Build quality is high, zipper runs smoothly, easy to pack and light. Reinforcement ribbon along the long axis allows it to be set up taut, and solid rear wall is nice for putting towards wind/water. Cons: Pricey for a mesh inner, and 15D floor is thin! Consider using a polypro groundsheet to boost longevity.
review.name: Well made and spacious

name: Thru-Hiker Mesh House 3

review.reviewBody: Prepping for a red rock canyon trip. Have a had a few days hiking with the crag 40 in preparation and it has really worked well. Easily holds all my gear + 70m rope with room to spare for snacks. Looking forward to running it up multi-pitches soon!
review.name: Prepping for a red rock

review.reviewBody: Wonderful lockers for the wall. Have been used many times and they remain strong. Screws seem to get a little less smooth as time goes along, but they work great, especially for tethering.
review.name: Great Small Lockers

review.reviewBody: Solid locker carabiner that I use for multiple functions climbing. Lately using it in my top rope solo setup. Suggest that the locking function has a red band (or other bright color) to show if it is not locked.
review.name: Great Light Weight Locker

review.reviewBody: Having climbed for a few decades and then stepped away for a while and now getting back into it, the plethora of choices out there was a shock.  One thing that is still the same as always is the quality and consistency of their products.  Picked these up for setting up TR and building anchors and they have performed as expected.
review.name: Black Diamond is always a good choice

review.reviewBody: Lightweight, strong, all around a great useful pick.
review.name: Hotforge Screwgate Carabiner 3-pack

review.reviewBody: I'm definitely a fan of these screwgates. They are very lightweight, the screwgate is smooth, and I found it easy to rack on these compared with others that have a bit of a hook on the nose that catches on things when you go to unclip.
review.name: Lightweight and solid!

review.reviewBody: Some of the best screw gate carabiners, especially for the price. Smooth screw mechanism and doesn't get stuck. Also a great size for multiple uses.
review.name: Excellent locking carabiners

review.reviewBody: These carabiners are light but secure enough to use belaying through an ATC or Grigri or for building anchors. Happy with my purchase
review.name: Great Carabiners!

review.reviewBody: Insanely light weight. The locking mechanism operates very smooth. Perfect size for multiple applications!
review.name: Hot forge Screwgate

review.reviewBody: Very well designed, light, super resistant and practical size and opening for BD Harnesses. Fully recommended.
review.name: HotForge Screwgate Carabiners
